runners.comment: Record of 1201, all on AW, since handicapping; can remain competitive

runners.name: Fear And Fast
runners.comment: Final 2yo effort took his form figures over 5f to 043; frame possibilities

runners.name: Jeany May

runners.name: Tees Aggregates
runners.owner: Ingleby Bloodstock Ltd & The Ivy League
runners.comment: Failed to progress from his Leicester win; gelded since last run
runners.spotlight: Successful handicap debut at Leicester (5f) last July; failed to match that form subsequently; chance depends on whether a physical tweak (gelded since last run) has positive effect.

stable_tour.quote: I got him from the breeze-ups and he's run two good races. He ran a cracker at Doncaster on his debut as he got broadsided but still finished off his race. He then went to Wetherby and again travelled really strongly. He looked like he was going to win before finishing a little tired in third. If he doesn't win his maiden, he should definitely be winning nurseries. 26-07-24

runners.name: The Feminine Urge
runners.comment: Won off 2lb higher in sole Catterick run (clear best form); interesting
runners.spotlight: Far from consistent but showed her clear best form in sole Catterick attempt, namely a success off 2lb higher last August (6f, good to firm); interesting returned to this venue.

quotes.race: Like Racing TV On Facebook Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I wasn't sure if we got up. I thought we had a great draw in stall one but it played against us. We were a few rows back further than I'd have liked and had to wait for a gap, but The Feminine Urge showed a good attitude when she got out - Callum Rodriguez, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Beerwah
runners.comment: Failed to back up debut promise but could be one to catch fresh
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden who has failed to back up debut promise; however, could be one to catch fresh, in which case there is cause for optimism on seasonal debut.

runners.name: Early Release
runners.comment: In good form on AW for new stable until a below-par effort last time
runners.spotlight: In good form (won once, placed twice) in sprint handicaps on AW for new stable until a below-par effort last time; may rebound, provided he's effective back on turf.

runners.name: Fallen Soldier
runners.comment: Still a maiden but is less exposed on turf than on AW; workable mark
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden after 14 attempts but is less exposed on grass than on AW; finished second off 3lb higher on sole attempt in a turf handicap; fighting chance back in this sphere.

runners.name: Coiled
runners.comment: Maiden for Eve Johnson Houghton; sold for 1,000gns since last run
runners.spotlight: Placed several times for Eve Johnson Houghton but failed to progress and has been beaten in selling grade; sold for 1,000gns since last run; others have stronger claims.

runners.name: She Went Whoosh
runners.comment: Still a maiden but has place claims on form; switches back to turf
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden but ties in with Jeany May and Fear And Fast on Nottingham form in November; achieved another second-place finish in one of her AW runs this year; place possibilities.

runners.name: Solar Biricz
runners.comment: Won well at Musselbugh in last attempt on good ground; not written off
runners.spotlight: Possibly unsuited by the soft surface in C&D event when last seen; won well, albeit in lower grade, at Musselburgh (5f) in last attempt on good ground and can't be written off.

runners.name: Barmyblade
runners.comment: Has largely unconvincing form
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden who gets plenty of weight all round due to his largely unconvincing form; failed to beat a rival over C&D in last appearance; opposed.

3:13.race_name: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap
3:13.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watered)

runners.name: Arctic Fox

prev_owners.owner: Colin Taylor And Miss Kay Wilding

runners.comment: Combination of drop in class and step back up in distance may have positive effect
runners.spotlight: Has failed to win since 2022; however, this combination of a drop in class and step back up in distance may have positive effect, with Doncaster reappearance under her belt.

quotes.race: Queen Mother's Cup Handicap (For Lady Amateur Riders)
quotes.quote: It's the right time of year for the three-year-olds taking on the older horses. Arctic Fox has won three in a row and the step up in trip has not bothered her - Richard Fahey, trainer.

runners.name: Magnetic North
runners.comment: Ex-Irish veteran whose sole win for current yard came in a weak race over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish veteran whose sole success for current yard came in a weak selling handicap hurdle; failed to beat a rival in most recent Flat run; others preferred.

quotes.race: Tote Fantasy Who's In Your Stable Claiming Race
quotes.quote: That was my fourth win on Magnetic North, he's been a great servant to me, I rode my first winner on him. He's in the form of his life now. He loves that, dictating it and the tight bends around here really suited him - Adam Caffrey, jockey, talking to Racing TV

quotes.race: Donnybrook Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Magnetic North loves this ground. When he was a younger horse you would have said he wanted a bit of cut but he didn't want it today We weren't going to run him but I just felt that this track would suit and the trip as well - Ado McGuinness, trainer

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF "Nasrullah" Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Magnetic North got away with the ground. We took the chance because it was a big pot so we will probably head to Galway now because we think he would prefer softer ground - Sheila Lavery, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing Again At Navan July 13th Handicap
quotes.quote: We've always liked him and we were very excited about him last year as a three-year-old but he just had real niggly problems. I think he just needs a bit of juice. He ran in Gowran on Wednesday and Robbie said he kept galloping but he just couldn't pick up on the ground, whereas today he absolutely loved it. The ground might just be the key to him. It doesn't have to be soft but just like today, a little softer than good. I threw him into the Royal Hunt Cup at Ascot but he won't get in. I'll look for something similar and hope that it rains - Sheila Lavery, trainer

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Median Auction Maiden
quotes.quote: Magnetic North is one we've always liked but he seemed to get stagefright as a two-year-old and first time this year at Gowran he didn't have a clue and was all over the place. Today he was much more professional and I hope he still has huge improvement in him - Sheila Lavery, trainer

runners.name: Mon Etoile
runners.comment: Finished lame when last seen; has plenty of respectable form otherwise; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Finished lame when last seen six months ago; opened her account in Newcastle event (12.5f, AW) the time before and had plenty of placed form earlier in 2024; capable of being involved.

runners.name: Flying Scotsman

prev_owners.owner: John P McManus, Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
John P McManus, Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

runners.comment: In-form contender, having won and performed respectably at Newcastle this year
runners.spotlight: Hasn't scored on turf since 2022 (when trained in Ireland) but he's an in-form contender, having won and performed respectably at Newcastle (12.5f, AW) this year; fighting chance.

quotes.race: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap
quotes.quote: We'd been scratching our heads with Flying Scotsman, he'd been a hard horse to get right. The application of blinkers seemed to help and he's just a horse you have to catch at the right time - Ben Haslam, trainer.

quotes.race: Listowel Printing Works Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: That was some ride from Wayne [Lordan]. He said Flying Scotsman was always coming back underneath him, was on and off the bridle, but knew once he turned in he would stay the trip well. He said he is a genuine horse when you do ask him. He has been disappointing over hurdles and it is nice to win another nice handicap. He goes flat through a race, but is genuine when it comes to the business end, and with that light weight on his back he must have thought he was loose - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: caulfieldindustrial.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Flying Scotsman is a versatile little sod and he's as tough as nails. The cheekpieces made a bit of a difference as they sharpened him up. He's in again at Leopardstown on Friday and we'll just have to see about that - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer

quotes.race: Eventus Handicap
quotes.quote: I think the step up in trip and soft ground suited him. Last time he ran a nice race when they just quickened away from him on quicker ground at Leopardstown. He got into a bit of trouble and it probably suited him as well. He's declared again tomorrow but I'll leave that to Joseph and see how he is. He's had a tough enough race today to win. It was a good performance today, it wasn't the greatest race in the world but he's a Galileo and the step in trip suited him - Brendan Powell, assistant to Joseph O'Brien, trainer of Flying Scotsman

stable_tour.quote: He won twice in as many days on the Flat at Galway. We've gelded him and are looking forward to sending him over hurdles, when I hope there will be some fun to be had with him. 09-11-20

runners.name: Twoforthegutter
runners.comment: Dual winner at Hamilton; his Catterick form features two second-place finishes
runners.spotlight: Has gained both wins at Hamilton (1m4f/1m5f, good) but his Catterick form features two second-place finishes; solid chance off a competitive mark on seasonal debut.

runners.name: Stellarmasterpiece

runners.comment: Has form figures of 313 in British Flat starts, the success over C&D; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Returns to this code following an ineffectual spell over hurdles; has form figures of 313 in British Flat starts, the success off just 2lb lower over C&D (good) last May; possibilities.

runners.name: Mr Globalist

runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish maiden who isn't particularly solid judged on his hurdles form for new stable; returns to the Flat for first time since 2022; not sure what to expect from him.

prev_owners.owner: Clova Farms And P D Niven

runners.spotlight: Maiden who has been campaigned on AW since switched to the Flat; showed some promise on penultimate start (handicap debut) but needs improvement to get off the mark.

quotes.quote: Saisons D'Or battled well to the line. He's a consistent horse and the mile suited him well here. He was a bit gassy as a youngster but settles much better now and that enables him to stay this trip - Jack Garritty, jockey.

runners.name: Darbucks

runners.name: Desert Dream
runners.comment: Three C&D wins but will need to be at his peak to win this on return

runners.name: Doomsday

runners.name: American Star

runners.name: Lion Ring
runners.comment: 0-13 on turf and weakened over 6f five days ago; return to  7f doesn't tempt
runners.spotlight: 0-13 on turf and he weakened over 6f at Leicester (good to firm) five days ago; well beaten on his two previous attempts at 7f away from AW (on soft and good to firm).

runners.name: Coconut Bay
runners.comment: Gets a 5lb swing for a neck defeat by Doomsday last week; clear chance of revenge
runners.spotlight: Won a Wolverhampton classified (7f) in February and went down narrowly to Doomsday at Musselburgh (7f, good) one week ago; gets a 5lb swing for that neck defeat, giving her obvious claims of gaining revenge.

runners.name: Likeashadow

prev_owners.owner: S McMillan, S Boyle & A D Brown

runners.comment: Returns to turf having been in the doldrums on AW; big turnaround required
runners.spotlight: Has been in the doldrums since a fair effort when third at Newcastle (1m) in November and needs this return to turf and a tumbling mark to spark a major turnaround; blinkers refitted in place of other aids.

quotes.race: Best Racing Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a messy race and Likeashadow is definitely still progressing. To do it, especially at your hometown track, means a lot. I had lots of success there as a jockey, including that day with Sea Pigeon - Alan Brown, trainer.

runners.name: Miss Willows
runners.breeder: R M Whitaker & Hellwood Stud Farm
runners.comment: Sole win over C&D but best on soft ground and that's not looking likely
runners.spotlight: Gained her only success when scoring over C&D last July (second-time cheekpieces, no headgear today) but that came on soft ground, as did her other three best peformances on turf; can go well fresh but would be much more interesting if rain arrived, which isn't forecast.

quotes.race: Pinker's Pond Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Miss Willows loves a bit of cut in the ground. She didn't have a lot of luck in running the last time she ran and I told Ben [Sanderson, jockey] today to just sit where you're happy - Simon Whitaker, trainer.

runners.name: Dandy Lichious
runners.comment: Won his only race on AW at Dundalk and ran poorly last time
runners.spotlight: Couple of respectable efforts in AW classifieds in January but only seventh of ten (behind Coconut Bay) when favourite at Wolverhampton in February and ran poorly at Newcastle (all over 7f) last time; unconvincing.

runners.name: Too Much Too Young

prev_owners.owner: Ck Racing And Ursa Major Racing Ltd

runners.comment: Shock winner over C&D (first-time cheekpieces) in August; moderate on AW lately
runners.spotlight: Just 1-22 but on the plus side that win came over C&D (good; 40-1) last August, when wearing first-time cheekpieces; three AW runs since the turn of the year temper confidence.

5:20.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watered)

runners.name: Daytona Lady
runners.owner: Eric Broadwith And Mrs Ruth Carr
runners.comment: Has done well for this yard; contender if fully tuned up for this first run since November
runners.spotlight: Made debut for this yard in October 2023 and has won five times since, including on turf and at Wolverhampton (6f, AW) last September; a contender if fully tuned up for this first run since November.

quotes.race: It's Time To Turn To talkSPORT Handicap
quotes.quote: I don't think Daytona Lady liked Kempton the last day. She's been working very well at home - Darragh Keenan, rider, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: She was busy last year, racing 18 times and winning four on the all-weather andass, so she's had aeak since November. She's in good shape and goes to Catterick on Wednesday over 6f. A turning six furlongs is what suits her best. She'll need to improve some if she's to achieve what she achieved last year. 09-04-25

runners.name: Animate
runners.owner: Tom Goodair, Jimmy Kay, John Beamson
runners.comment: Well beaten more often than not last season but won off this mark over C&D last June
runners.spotlight: Well beaten most often than not last season but he won over C&D (good to soft) last June on his sole previous course visit and reappears off the same mark today; not ruled out now back here.

quotes.race: 5th Regiment Royal Artillery Handicap
quotes.quote: When I first got Animate I thought he was going to be a proper horse. He's been a bit disappointing, but I've taken the extra headgear off and he's loved it today. That's the first time he's won on turf, hopefully he can take off from it. I haven't had him that long, but I've found the key to him and he'll go forward now -  Geoffrey Harker, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Act Of Violence
runners.breeder: Mrs S Field, Miss S Field & Mr A Turbitt
runners.owner: Peter R Ball, Gentech Ltd & Partners
runners.comment: C&D winner who scored at Ripon last July; campaign concluded with two good efforts
runners.spotlight: Won C&D maiden (soft) in September 2023 and back on the scoresheet in Ripon handicap (6f, good) last July; campaign concluded with two good runs in defeat and this lightly raced 4yo could still have more to offer.

runners.name: Dapperling
runners.comment: Disappointing in the main last season but today's comeback could be the time to catch her
runners.spotlight: Just one win from her 16 starts and disappointing in the main last season; however, one of her best runs came on her reappearance and she's dropped to a dangerous mark; this comeback run may be the time to catch her.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Super Sprint Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Dapperling ran a blinder and has plenty of speed and a great mentality. She's a nice, scopey filly who is going the right way - Sean Levey, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: She ran a very good race when third the other day at Wolverhampton and travelled well. Physically she's done extremely well and will be a nice filly for the sprint handicaps. She might even get a bit of black type later on in the year. 29-04-24

runners.name: Fenlander
runners.breeder: M H Sly & Mrs P M Sly

prev_owners.owner: Michael H Sly & Mrs Pam Sly

runners.comment: Well beaten last spring in his first two handicaps but returns with stable in good form
runners.spotlight: Well beaten last spring in his first two handicaps and absent since; however, he showed promise during his 2yo campaign in 2023 and returns to action with his stable in good form; no surprise to see a good run.

runners.name: Sacred Falls
runners.comment: Often ran well in these cheekpieces last year, including when fresh; in with a chance
runners.spotlight: Often ran well in these cheekpieces last year, and they go back on for this reappearance run following a lesser effort in blinkers in December; returns on a competitive mark and has gone well in the past when fresh.

runners.name: Mister Sox
runners.comment: Both wins have come here; on a competitive mark; his best form has come on slow ground
runners.spotlight: Both wins have come here (7f/6f, soft/good to soft) and he was in pretty good form last autumn when last seen; on a competitive mark but his claims may hinge on conditions; his best form has come on slow ground.

runners.name: Protest Rally
runners.owner: Mrs C M Clarke, Foulrice Park Racing Ltd
runners.comment: Progressive at 5f last year; back up to 6f on reappearance but with trainer in good form
runners.spotlight: Progressive from June onwards last year, winning twice at Musselburgh (5f, good); the step back up to 6f poses a question but he returns with his trainer in good form and is entitled to respect.

runners.name: One Of Our Own
runners.comment: Remains without cheekpieces but excellent record here means she has to enter calculations

runners.spotlight: 9yo who was a regular runner over C&D last year, winning in April and finishing placed three times later in the campaign; ran well on his 2024 comeback and could have a part to play on this season's reappearance.

quotes.race: Follow @thirskraces On Twitter For Ticketing News Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Highjacked is straightforward, let him travel away and look he's done it easy in this grade - Danny Tudhope, jockey.

runners.name: Bazball
runners.comment: Her mark continues to fall but others make greater appeal than this regressive 4yo
runners.spotlight: Her mark continues to fall and she was a fair fourth on her stable debut at Newcastle (6f, AW) in January; however, two lesser runs have followed and others make greater appeal than this regressive 4yo.

2:13.race_name: Flat Season Starts Now Apprentice Handicap

runners.name: Latin Five

quotes.race: Killashee Hotel Nursery Handicap (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Latin Five is a horse we thought might win his maiden, but this was the first time he really raced professionally. He loved the stiff six and should go the seven at some stage. We'll see what the handicapper does - Joseph O'Brien, trainer

runners.name: Dunnington Lad

runners.comment: C&D winner; two wins at Ripon last summer; in the mix if fully tuned up on return

runners.name: Ninety Nine

runners.spotlight: Absent since below-par run at Southwell (AW) in December but in good form in these cheekpieces previously, winning over C&D (soft) in October; has also run well on good ground in the past; possible contender.

runners.name: Jamies Choice
runners.comment: Lightly raced 5yo who won twice last summer and could have more to offer
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 5yo who won twice last summer (5f, good/good to firm) and signed off with good second at Redcar (5f, good to firm) in September; could have more to offer and she's one to consider on reappearance.

stable_tour.quote: She's done well for us this year, winning two of her last four races, at Musselburgh and Redcar. She needed handicapping this year as that's what her job is. We got her at the back end of last year and I'm really pleased about the way she's been progressing. She didn't stay the 6f at Newcastle two starts ago, so we dropped her back to 5f at Redcar last time and she won again. She's still only on a mark of 54 and should be able to carry on progressing. 22-08-24

runners.name: Stroxx
runners.comment: Finds winning hard but was on the scoresheet in January and was short-headed last week
runners.spotlight: Finds winning hard, having won just two of his 62 starts, but he was on the scoresheet at Newcastle (5f, AW) in January and was short-headed at Musselburgh (5f, good) last Wednesday; could be bang there.

runners.name: Golden Prosperity
runners.comment: Poor strike-rate but won over C&D last August and could build on last month's reappearance
runners.spotlight: Just two wins from his 38 starts but latest victory came off this mark over C&D (good to firm) last August and last month's reappearance sixth at Newcastle gives him something to build on; possible player.

runners.name: Posh Maisie
runners.comment: Has dropped to a basement mark but not shaping as though she's about to get off the mark
runners.spotlight: Has dropped to a basement mark but this regressive filly hasn't been shaping as though she's about to get off the mark.

runners.name: Ustath
runners.comment: 9yo who has poor turf strike-rate but has been in fair form on AW and could be thereabouts
runners.spotlight: 9yo who is just 1-24 on turf as opposed to 10-67 on AW; however, he's been in fair form on AW of late and ran some good races in defeat on turf last summer; could be thereabouts.

quotes.race: Follow @thirskraces On Twitter For Ticketing News Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Ustath has not shown anything on turf but he ran last week at Catterick over five and wasn't quick enough, so we said that we would put him on a flat track over six and let him bowl. He enjoyed it and dug deeply - Ben Sanderson, jockey.

quotes.race: Heed Your Hunch At Betway Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Ustath did it quite well. He bounced out, travelled great and found plenty - Tyler Heard, jockey.

runners.name: Mews House
runners.comment: On long losing run but took step back in right direction last time and he likes it here
runners.spotlight: 8yo who is on a long losing run but he was an encouraging fourth at Newcastle (5f, AW) a fortnight ago on his second stable start and he was a three-time winner here earlier in his career; interesting contender.

3:43.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watered)

runners.name: Monsieur Fudge
runners.comment: Placed on first two starts; two lesser runs since but gelded subsequently; chance
runners.spotlight: Placed on first two starts (7f/1m, good/good to firm); two lesser runs followed last autumn but he returns having been gelded and wearing first-time blinkers, and he's a major player if rediscovering his best form.

runners.name: Stay In The Game
runners.comment: Went close at Beverley on the third of his four starts; could play a leading role
runners.spotlight: Third in September 2023 (7f/1m, good/heavy) on first two starts and went close in Beverley novice (1m2f, soft) last April; didn't run badly when seventh of eight on handicap debut at Beverley last August  (1m2f, good to firm; faded) and has the ability to play a leading role today.

runners.name: Free Pic
runners.comment: Well beaten at 125-1 on last month's belated debut and perhaps best watched for now
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to talented 6f/7f winner Trumble but she was well beaten at 125-1 on her belated debut at Southwell (7f, AW) three weeks ago and is perhaps best watched for now.

runners.name: Jolie Coeur Allen
runners.comment: Showed ability over hurdles but finished last on first two Flat starts
runners.spotlight: Showed ability without winning for Willie Mullins in a bumper and over hurdles; however, she finished last in November on her first two Flat starts and needs to be an entirely different proposition this afternoon.

runners.name: Aye Up Tom
runners.comment: Tailed off at 100-1 on last month's debut at Southwell (7f, AW); likely to need further
runners.spotlight: Dam was a 1m2f winner (RPR 78); tailed off at 100-1 on last month's debut at Southwell (7f, AW) and he's likely to need further in handicaps.

runners.name: Gloriously Sassy
runners.comment: Encouraging fourth on last month's debut at Southwell and could have a part to play
runners.spotlight: His dam was a useful 1m4f-2m winner and he could improve when tackling longer trips; however, there was promise in his debut fourth at Southwell three weeks ago (7f, AW; 14-1) and he could have a part to play.

runners.name: Tawasol
runners.comment: Runner-up at Wolverhampton in December on second start and holds strong claims
runners.spotlight: Had wind surgery after heavy debut defeat at Windsor (6f, soft) last August and went close at Wolverhampton (7f, AW) in December; this 240,000gns yearling is in good hands to continue to progress and has strong claims.

runners.name: Grizzieblanca
runners.owner: Nick Bradley Racing 51 & Mrs E Burke
runners.comment: Half-sister to two winners but slowly away and soundly beaten on her first two starts
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to two winners who is with a respected stable (one of two for the yard); however, she was soundly beaten at 22-1 and 150-1 last month on her first two starts (8.6f/7f, AW), when slowly away each time.

runners.name: Hyzenthlay Rah
runners.comment: Half-sister to five winners but always behind at 200-1 on recent debut over 5f on AW
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to five winners but she was always behind at 200-1 on her recent debut at Wolverhampton (5f, AW); transformation needed.

runners.name: Sweet Kiss
runners.comment: Stable has done well with her family; she may not come into her own until tackling further
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; half-sister to winners Highwaygrey (multiple 1m2f; RPR 93), Delgrey Boy (1m; 89), Albegrey (1m; 79) and Platinum Girl (7f; 76), all in these colours for Tim Easterby; this Ulysses newcomer may not come into her own until tackling further.

6:40.race_name: Try Unibet's New Improved Acca Boosts Handicap

runners.name: Yorkshire
runners.comment: Good 2024; could get back on track if taking to Polytrack
runners.spotlight: Began and ended 2024 in winning form; finished a length and a neck behind Blue Prince when only fifth at Southwell last time, not helping himself by racing keenly; could resume progress if taking to Polytrack.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely, big colt who did well last year to win a 6f novice at Redcar on his second run, having shown plenty when third on his debut at Haydock. The winter break did him the world of good and he came back looking superb. He defied his penalty first time out at Southwell in March and I thought he was a good thing to follow up back there this month, but he was collared on the line. Unfortunately, despite not winning he still went up 4lb to a rating of 87. He came out of that race well and we took him to York for his first run of the year on turf. It was a step up in class to a 0-105 handicap and, although he ran a fair race, he was no match for a Â­Â­well-handicapped winner. He's definitely one to look forward to as the year progresses. 01-06-23

runners.name: Blue Prince
runners.comment: Handicapped to win and Oisin Murphy returning to the saddle is a plus
runners.spotlight: Beat 17 rivals off this mark at Goodwood last summer and went down by a short head and a head off it at Southwell last time; Oisin Murphy, who finished third and second on him early last year, returns to the saddle; player; course debut but handles Polytrack.

quotes.race: 50K ITV7 Weekly Jackpot Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Blue Prince picked up and put the race to bed very smartly. He's an improving colt who has plenty of ability in the tank - Cam Hardie, jockey.

runners.name: Grand Karat
runners.comment: Readily won two of his three starts at Southwell last year following a gelding operation
runners.spotlight: Readily won two of his three starts at Southwell last year following a gelding operation; new mark demands more but he appeals as the type to find extra at four; yard had a winner who was returning from a break at Southwell on Sunday.

runners.name: Aquacell
runners.comment: Much better can be expected, particularly if returning hood has the desired effect
runners.spotlight: Won on debut this time last year and beat a good yardstick at Southwell in November; caught wide when three places behind Blue Prince there 19 days ago and she can be given another chance, particularly as that was her first start in 93 days; hood returns.

runners.name: United Approach
runners.comment: Hard to fancy on what we saw last back end; betting might provide clues on return
runners.spotlight: This lightly-raced 5yo looked a nice prospect to begin with; he's hard to fancy on what we saw last back end, though; betting might provide clues as to what's expected on his return.

stable_tour.quote: He looked to have a touch of class last season and after a very nice introduction at Ascot he followed up three weeks later with an impressive win over 6f at Ayr. He's from a family that aren't known for being two-year-olds, so the fact he managed to win last year was very encouraging. He's set to return over 6f at Doncaster this month and I hope he'll emerge as a black-type performer. 19-04-23

runners.name: Arctic Thunder
runners.comment: Bit to prove starting out for new yard having been gelded; first run since August
runners.spotlight: Maiden win came over C&D but Ascot handicap success doesn't read well; down the field when sent off favourite the last twice and he has a bit to prove starting out for a new yard (left Andrew Balding; changed hands for 50,000gns) having been gelded; first run since August.

runners.name: Brunel Nation
runners.breeder: S A S Haute Vallee & Charlotte Hutchinso
runners.owner: R Lane, L Watson & J Langridge
runners.comment: Capable of much better than we saw on return
runners.spotlight: Won three of his nine starts last year; sent off favourite when back from 168 days off at Wolverhampton last month but things didn't go his way (left poorly placed and hung off the home turn); better expected here; yard won this in 2024.

quotes.race: Turners Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a funny race. They went off too fast in front and I held onto their coat tails and Brunel Nation toughed it out - winning rider Finley Marsh

stable_tour.quote: He's a fast-ground horse and there's a race at Newmarket for him over 7f. He's hit the crossbar a few times this year but is a winner in waiting. 18-09-24

runners.name: Tadreeb
runners.comment: Fine 2025 for new yard but might come up short in this Class 3; non-runner
runners.spotlight: Very well handicapped when joining Rod Millman and racked up an 11-day hat-trick over this trip at Lingfield in January; took to this place when finding just one too good last month; might come up short in this Class 3; non-runner.

quotes.race: Win Â£1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap
quotes.quote: Tadreeb is obviously in very good form and we've been very lucky to inherit him, as he's a very nice horse. He's got very good back form and was quite classy in his day. Michael [Attwater, previous trainer] did very well with him, but sometimes a change of yard can just perk them up again. We'll be looking at running him here next week - Rod Millman, trainer.

quotes.race: MansionBet Proud Partners Of The AWC Handicap
quotes.quote: Tadreeb has to be ridden like that and it was a muddling pace. I think the plan is to run him on Good Friday if the handicapper allows. He could be a nice type for the turf - William Carson, rider.

5:40.race_name: Free Bet With Unibet's Betbuilder Rebound Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Dopamine
runners.comment: Tough task to give the weight away to the 3yos but Liam Wright's 5lb claim will help
runners.spotlight: Giant step forward to win at the second attempt last year, beating four rivals at Southwell (7f); carries 7lb penalty; tough task to give the weight away to the 3yos but Liam Wright's 5lb claim will help.

runners.name: Bijoux
runners.comment: Knew her job when scoring on debut three weeks ago; more to do
runners.spotlight: Knew her job at Southwell three weeks ago, travelling fluently and knuckling down well to get the better of a Gosden newcomer (1m; 9-2); carries 7lb penalty; more to do.

runners.name: Kon Tiki
runners.comment: This 1,000 Guineas entry did well to justify favouritism on her sole start last year
runners.spotlight: This 1,000 Guineas entry did well to justify favouritism at Wolverhampton on her sole start last year as the second and third were in the van throughout and she came from off the pace; carries 7lb penalty; should benefit from this step up to 1m; key player.

runners.name: Life Is Beautiful
runners.comment: Struck over C&D in November; looks sure to make up into a better 3yo
runners.spotlight: Promising performance over C&D in November, mowing down a couple of similarly well-connected runners who had the benefit of experience; carries 7lb penalty; looks sure to make up into a better 3yo.

runners.name: Opera Score
runners.comment: Taking performance on last month's debut; go very well from the rail draw
runners.spotlight: Seemingly didn't beat much, although the Karl Burke newcomer was solid in the betting, at Wolverhampton last month (8.6f; 6-5) but it was a taking performance; carries 7lb penalty; go very well from the rail draw.

runners.name: Stateira
runners.comment: Another winner on debut; highly likely to leave bare form behind
runners.spotlight: Seemingly wasn't expected to make a winning debut at Southwell in February (SP 28-1; yard's other runner was sent off 10-1) but she was strong at the finish over 7f to score by 2l; carries 5lb penalty; highly likely to step forward.

quotes.race: Weekly Free Bets With BetMGM Extra Restricted Novice Stakes (For Horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB)
quotes.quote: That was impressive. We've liked Stateira's work at home and she was very professional throughout. We managed to get a nice position from a decent draw. I was able to follow the horse in front like a piece of work and she's gone and done it quite smartly. She's a lovely big type who is built like a colt and has a great head on her and she's going to come on from that today as well - Nicola Currie, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Badiyah
runners.comment: Faced with six previous winners on debut but market check needed
runners.spotlight: 140,000gns yearling; by Wootton Bassett; fourth foal; half-sister to couple of AW winners; dam 1m-1m1f winner (including US Grade 3; RPR 108); faced with six previous winners on debut but market check needed.

runners.name: Inquisition
runners.comment: Ought to make up into a nice 3yo for her new yard but this looks a tough starter
runners.spotlight: Hinted at ability in sole outing for Sir Michael Stoute last year (7f, here; beaten just over 9l); ought to make up into a nice 3yo for her new yard but this looks a tough starter.

runners.name: Miss Chester
runners.comment: Faces very tough task on debut
runners.spotlight: By Ribchester; sixth foal; half-sister to four winners, including J R Cavagin (5f/5.6f; RPR 82); dam French 1m2f/12.5f winner; faces very tough task on debut.

runners.name: Nuptown Girl
runners.comment: Should find a race this year but doubt this will be it
runners.spotlight: Showed a bit despite battling greenness in sole start at two (6f here); should find a race this year but doubt this will be it.

runners.name: Polygram
runners.comment: Should make into a winning 3yo for her new yard but looks one for another day
runners.spotlight: Like Inquisition, she showed enough on her sole start for Sir Michael Stoute last year (sixth of seven over 7f at Newbury) to think she'll make into a winning 3yo for her new yard; could be one for another day, though.

runners.name: True Colors
runners.comment: Better off with Bijoux on Southwell running but needs to keep straighter; non-runner
runners.spotlight: Pleasing introduction, despite hanging left, when close third to Bijoux at Southwell three weeks ago (1m); has 7lb pull with that rival here; sound claims, though needs to keep straighter; non-runner.

7:10.race_name: Unibet Support Safer Gambling Fillies' Handicap

runners.name: Court Drive
runners.comment: Easy C&D win in January; not so good twice since but a danger to all if back to her best
runners.spotlight: Wide-margin win over C&D in January; not quite so good on Tapeta twice since but back amongst her own sex today and she'll be a danger to all if back at her best.

stable_tour.quote: She won at 50-1 on her first run at Wolverhampton, over 7f, in early April. I paid very little money for her but I just liked her as she was walking around the paddock. She had a little bit of an ugly right-handed ankle but that didn't bother me as I bought her off my own bat and turned her out for two months. She has very good owners in Premier Racing, who own 60 per cent of her with two of my other owners. They've had five horses with me and they've all won- three of them, including her, won first time out. The thing is that by winning first time out the handicapper will take a dim view of that, so my view, like my dad's, is that you're better off going to a decent fillies' race, so we ran her in a 6f Listed race at Chelmsford last week. 08-05-24

runners.name: Unico
runners.comment: 0-8 for current stable but retains ability; drawn widest back from 145 days off
runners.spotlight: Won twice for Marco Botti, including on Polytrack; 0-8 for current stable but there were some near misses last year; drawn widest on return from 145 days off and others are more appealing.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Acca Bonus Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Unico is probably still a little bit green and a bit on her nerves. When she got to the front she was still a bit unsure about what to do but I think she did it nicely. We've had a little downpour which has probably helped - Josie Gordon, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Papabella
runners.comment: On the up in second half of 2024; stable historically do well in the spring; may do better
runners.spotlight: Off the mark in a 6f handicap at Ffos Las last July and she ran well on her next three starts too, winning at Leicester (6f, soft) either side of third-place finishes at Goodwood and Leicester; absent for six months but stable historically do well in the spring months; could have further progress in her this year.

runners.name: Four Adaay
runners.comment: On handy mark and ran well for 4th over C&D two weeks ago; contender back against females
runners.spotlight: 3lb lower than for her Sandown win last September (5f) and ran her best race of this campaign when a close fourth over C&D two weeks ago; Oisin Murphy retains the ride; one to consider back against her own sex.

stable_tour.quote: She's been a bit out of sorts but has become very well-handicapped. She was a very unlucky loser last month at Nottingham where she got in a bit of trouble, so she should pick up a few races between now and the end of the season. 11-07-24

runners.name: Kensington Agent
runners.comment: 2lb rise for latest Wolverhampton win not excessive; other pace to deal with & drawn wide
runners.spotlight: Off the mark for the year when keeping on well to win a Class 6 at Wolverhampton (6f) last month; that effort backed up by the Topspeed figure and Jack Doughty's useful claim helps offset the 2lb rise; other pace on show here though and a lower draw would have been preferable.

runners.name: Rift Valley
runners.comment: Not seen to best effect on last month's handicap debut/reappearance; down 3lb; unexposed
runners.spotlight: Promise on her second and third 2yo starts; beaten over 4l into fourth on her handicap debut/reappearance at Newcastle 18 days ago but she was held up in a race where the first three were prominent throughout; dropped 3lb and capable of better.

runners.name: Bermuda Princess
runners.comment: Only 6th here (7f) on stable debut 14 days ago but there was promise in the run; unexposed
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in three fillies' novice/maiden events for William Haggas last summer; absent until returning over 7f here two weeks ago (stable debut), a race where she could only manage sixth but shaped with a fair bit more promise having made an eyecatching move early in the straight; the return to 6f can help and she could take a step forward with that run behind her; one to take seriously.

runners.name: Run To My Side
runners.comment: Low mileage but failed to improve for switch to handicaps last month; improvement a must
runners.spotlight: No improvement for the switch to handicaps when sixth of nine at Newcastle four weeks ago (6f); dropped 2lb and Hollie Doyle back on board but others look more appealing for win purposes.

runners.name: One For Harvey
runners.comment: Ran well for second in new cheekpieces last month (6f); up 1lb in a stronger race today
runners.spotlight: Back to form when a close second at Chelmsford two weeks ago (6f; made the running in first-time cheekpieces); 1lb higher mark against stronger opposition here so needs another step forward.

runners.name: Psychodrama
runners.comment: Had an excuse last time but she's not looking progressive; hood returns for stable debut
runners.spotlight: Latest effort excusable (caught wide over 7f, a trip she's not proven at) but she isn't progressing and needs a career best if she is to shed her maiden status on her first run for a new stable; the hood returns tonight.

5:10.race_name: Unibet Zero% Mission Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Brightling
runners.comment: Trainer already had a first-time-out 2yo winner but this one was withdrawn last week
runners.spotlight: By Aclaim; first foal; dam 6f winner (including AW; RPR 81), half-sister to three winners; got loose before the start of intended debut at Southwell last week and was withdrawn (12-1 at the time; left just three runners); trainer already had a first-time-out 2yo winner (under Lewis Edmunds; 18-1).

runners.name: Just Dreaming
runners.comment: Trainer just 6% with 2yos last five years; probably best watched
runners.spotlight: 9,000gns yearling; by Dream Ahead; sixth foal; half-sister to three winners, two won at two and on AW; dam placed 5f 2yo (RPR 63), out of Group-placed 7f 2yo winner; trainer just 6% with 2yos last five years; probably best watched.

runners.name: Kuiama
runners.comment: Trainer had just one juvenile winner from 107 runners last five years; others more obvious
runners.spotlight: 15,000gns yearling; by Space Blues; fourth foal; half-sister to two 2yo winners; dam Listed-placed 5f 2yo winner (RPR 92); trainer had just one juvenile winner from 107 runners last five years; others more obvious.

runners.name: Paroda Diva
runners.owner: Mps Racing Ltd, Roger Thompson & Partner
runners.comment: Surely needs good step forward from last week's debut to take this
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to four winners but made only minor late headway into fifth of nine (beaten over 7l) on debut at Bath last week (sent off 22-1); surely needs good step forward to take this.

runners.name: Very Mindful
runners.comment: First juvenile runner of the year for Archie Watson; watch market
runners.spotlight: 9,000gns foal; 20,000gns yearling; by Havana Gold; second foal; dam 5f winner (including 2yo/AW; RPR 77); trainer, who landed this with a newcomer in 2023, 14% with 2yos last five years; this one will be his first juvenile runner of the year; watch market.

runners.name: Viamarie
runners.comment: Trainer's first 2yo runner of the year flopped but he operates at around 16% with them
runners.spotlight: By Mehmas; sixth foal; closely related to Listed-placed 6f winner First Folio (RPR 106), half-sister to two winners including The Actor (5f 2yo; 86); dam 1m2f winner (83), out of 7f winning close relative of high-class sprinting 2yo Damson; trainer's first 2yo runner of the year flopped but he operates at around 16% with them.

8:10.race_name: Unibet More Extra Place Races Handicap

runners.name: Houndsworth
runners.comment: Surely better than we saw on last month's handicap debut; Rossa Ryan rides again
runners.spotlight: Went backwards from a fair start last year; handicap debut off a 206-day break and following a gelding operation didn't go well but he was sent off just 5-1 and is presumably thought capable of much better; worth another go over 1m4f; hood goes on; Rossa Ryan rides again.

runners.name: Justenzia
runners.comment: Interesting candidate upped in trip from 1m and tackling a handicap for the first time
runners.spotlight: Showed something each start at two and three of the runners she finished in and around last time have come out and won; interesting candidate upped in trip from 1m and tackling a handicap for the first time.

runners.name: West Wickham
runners.comment: Ran okay on handicap debut/return last week but further rise in trip needs to eke out more
runners.spotlight: Ran okay from a poor position when upped to 9.4f for handicap debut/return at Wolverhampton last week but it's highly likely he'll need to improve for this new trip to be seriously competitive here; visor quickly discarded.

runners.name: Van Aert
runners.comment: Could be a different proposition handicapping this year having been gelded; up 5f
runners.spotlight: Second last or last in trio of turf novices/maidens over 7f at two; could be a different proposition handicapping this year having been gelded; tackles 1m4f here and his stamina will come from sire Masar.

runners.name: Staffordshire
runners.comment: Pulls hard; this 0-65 handicap offers him a realistic chance of playing a part at least
runners.spotlight: Best effort when a well-beaten fourth of eight on debut here in January (1m3f); again didn't help his rider by pulling hard last time; this 0-65 handicap offers him a realistic chance of playing a part in the finish at least; hood retained.

runners.name: Godstone
runners.comment: Take seriously back over more suitable trip for handicap debut; cheekpieces go on
runners.spotlight: Showed much more than on his debut over 1m in January when making the frame in a C&D maiden before taking a backwards step over 9.4f; take seriously on handicap debut with cheekpieces fitted.

runners.name: Captain Brett
runners.breeder: Mountain View Stud & J C B/Stock
runners.comment: More competitive up in trip/handicapping this year but over 5l is the closest he's got
runners.spotlight: More competitive up in trip/handicapping this year but over 5l is the closest he's got; ran in snatches and merely plugged on last time; surprise if he's good enough; no hood on this occasion.

7:40.race_name: Try Unibet's New Smartview Racecards Handicap

runners.name: Summer Of Light
runners.comment: Lost her way for Michael Wigham and didn't do enough on yard debut 12 days ago
runners.spotlight: Lost her way for Michael Wigham and didn't do enough when starting out for Denis Quinn off a break at Lingfield 12 days ago to warrant backing here; hood removed.

runners.name: Jack Andrea
runners.owner: J Rayment, J Stephenson & R Eddery
runners.comment: Low-key return over C&D a fortnight ago and can only watch
runners.spotlight: Juvenile campaign ended with a couple of poor efforts; low-key return over C&D a fortnight ago, having been gelded, and can only watch here; cheekpieces return.

runners.name: Arlecchinos Rex
runners.comment: Had done little wrong in handicaps until meeting plenty of trouble last time; player
runners.spotlight: Made winning nursery debut, having been gelded, at Wolverhampton in November and bounced back from a lesser effort to be runner-up over C&D; latest effort not worth dwelling on as he was hampered more than once; player with Oisin Murphy booked; hood removed.

runners.name: Off The Bench
runners.comment: Chance on what he showed for second new yard latest; return to 7f is in his favour
runners.spotlight: Pleasing start for second new yard off 185-day break at Chelmsford last month (well backed) and the good late work he did over 6f there bodes well for this return to 7f; chance.

runners.name: Rumba Bay
runners.comment: Plenty to like and stall 14 might not be terminal (she can be held onto)
runners.spotlight: Two wins from four starts since joining David Evans from Dermot Weld; got first run on the second when back sprinting last time but held on; up 3lb; stall 14 isn't as bad for her as it would be for some as she can be held onto; involved.

runners.name: Broadhaven Bay
runners.comment: Trainer has made a great start to the year but this one might be best watched
runners.spotlight: Left it very late to make a winning nursery debut; not in the same form next time (also on fast ground at Brighton); trainer has made a great start to the year but this one might be best watched back from 220 days off; drawn wide for AW debut.

runners.name: Take The Boat
runners.comment: Back-to-back wins here in February and competitive off this mark at Wolverhampton in March
runners.spotlight: Back-to-back wins here in February (1m/7f) and competitive off this mark at Wolverhampton in March (9.4f); claims if holding her position early from rail draw.

runners.name: Fortunas Dream
runners.comment: Can only watch having failed to beat a rival on last month's yard debut
runners.spotlight: Standout effort for Muir-Grassick partnership came here in December (sixth in 1m novice); 80-1 and failed to beat a rival on debut for this yard last month (7f); can only watch; hood removed.

runners.name: California Fling
runners.comment: This 0-60 looks a good spot for her first handicap and market can guide
runners.spotlight: Improver from low base in novice company this year; up a furlong; this 0-60 looks a good spot for her first handicap and market can guide.

runners.name: Yesterdays Gone
runners.comment: Could be the answer on handicap debut over this extra furlong; trainer red hot
runners.spotlight: First run of note when back from 178 days off at Wolverhampton in February (beaten over 4l into sixth) and looked to be crying out for at least a seventh furlong; this half-sister to four winners is a handicap debutante to note; trainer operating at around a 35% strike-rate this year.

runners.name: Vizzavona Lady
runners.comment: Market can guide on AW (half-brother Above has won five times on it) and handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Fair run at Bath in September is flanked by poor ones at Deauville and Newmarket; market can guide on AW (her half-brother Above has won five times on artificial surfaces) and handicap debut.

runners.name: Adversary
runners.comment: Positives to take from runs two and three but never looked happy on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Positives to take from runs two and three but never looked happy (including hanging right) when sent off 15-2 for handicap debut at Wolverhampton last month; cheekpieces replace tongue-tie.

runners.name: Me Tarzan
runners.comment: Made the frame in a couple of nurseries but didn't look a winner in waiting; now gelded
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in a couple of nurseries but didn't look a winner in waiting; still, he's in good hands and a subsequent gelding operation could help; drawn wider than ideal.

runners.name: Lunanova
runners.comment: Could step forward in this modest handicap with Jack Dace taking off 7lb
runners.spotlight: Fair third of nine on New Year's Eve debut at Lingfield and C&D run two weeks ago wasn't devoid of hope either; could step forward in this modest handicap with Jack Dace taking off 7lb.

runners.name: Environment
runners.comment: Trailed in last of five on belated debut and has to give weight away to the 3yos here
runners.spotlight: Stiff task to beat a previous winner on belated debut at Newcastle last month (7f) but trailed in last of the five runners; sole older horse taking on 3yos here.

runners.name: Cosmic Year
runners.comment: Currently around an 8-1 shot for the 2,000 Guineas; tough to beat
runners.spotlight: Created a very favourable impression when striding clear at Sandown in September (7f), his sole start at two; carries 7lb penalty here; is still in Saturday's Greenham (Group 3) and holds entries in the 2,000 Guineas (currently around an 8-1 shot) and Irish 2,000 Guineas; tough to beat.

quotes.race: Unibet Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We knew looking at the race there was no pace and that we weren't going to make the running as we'd learn nothing if we did. The thing to take away from it I thought was they walked round and Cosmic Year is never going to pick up the bridle. He just lobs round behind them and if you've got a horse that's been doing fast work at home they often can be keen but he never thought about it. I said to Oisin [Murpy, jockey] to teach him something in the final furlong - Harry Charlton, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Sir Michael Stoute - Farewell And Thank You Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We'll go home and see what Barry [Mahon, Juddmonte's racing manager] wants to do. I'm sure Juddmonte are struggling to fit all their horses in the stakes races. We wanted to run Cosmic Year at Newbury in July but we took him out because the ground was too quick. He went away and lost a bit of weight going to the races so we didn't want to rush him. We waited for a couple of weeks, then there wasn't a suitable race, so we came here. Having not had a run, it would've been hard to enter him in those better races - Harry Charlton, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: An Fear Beag
runners.comment: 100-1 and passed just a few beaten rivals on debut over C&D a fortnight ago; best watched
runners.spotlight: 100-1 and passed just a few beaten rivals on debut over C&D a fortnight ago; best watched.

runners.name: Ashen
runners.comment: Pleasing introduction in May but took big backward step the following month; now gelded
runners.spotlight: Pleasing introduction at Goodwood in May but took big backward step at Salisbury the following month; absent since and gelded in the interim; tackles extra furlong here.

runners.name: Hit Squad
runners.breeder: Old Carhue Stud & Qatar Bloodstock Ltd
runners.comment: 95,000euros yearling; by Kameko; makes each-way appeal
runners.spotlight: 95,000euros yearling; by Kameko; fifth foal; half-brother to three winners, including Villanova Queen (Group-placed 7.4f/1m; RPR 108); dam unraced half-sister to 1m Group 1 winner Here Comes When; makes each-way appeal.

runners.name: Honved
runners.comment: Not quite so good from the front last time but is still a place contender
runners.spotlight: Got the better of a previous winner but found a fellow newcomer just too strong on debut at Wolverhampton last month; made the running but backed out of it rather quickly at Doncaster ten days ago; still, he's a place contender.

runners.name: Inca Trail
runners.comment: Finished four places behind stablemate and re-opposing Ashen on debut at Goodwood in May
runners.spotlight: 33-1 when finishing four places behind stablemate and re-opposing Ashen on debut at Goodwood in May (6f; looked in need of the experience); gelded since; can only watch.

runners.name: Luzon Prince
runners.comment: 200-1 and beaten by all seven rivals, including stablemate and re-opposing Maury, on debut
runners.spotlight: 200-1 and beaten by all seven rivals, including stablemate and re-opposing Maury, on debut at Lingfield last month (6f); can't consider.

runners.name: Maury
runners.comment: Debut effort at Lingfield last month wasn't devoid of hope but much more is needed
runners.spotlight: His fifth of eight on debut at Lingfield last month (6f; sent off 125-1) wasn't devoid of hope but much more is needed.

runners.name: Mister Sandman
runners.comment: Beat just three home when sent off 125-1 for debut over C&D a fortnight ago
runners.spotlight: Beat just three home when sent off 125-1 for debut over C&D a fortnight ago; highly likely he's one for handicaps down the line.

runners.name: National Park
runners.comment: Cosmic Year sets a very good standard but market can guide for this newcomer
runners.spotlight: By Dubawi; second foal; half-brother to 1m4f winner Campaign Medal (RPR 73); dam Group-placed 1m winner (105), sister to couple of Group winners; Cosmic Year sets a very good standard but market can guide.

runners.name: Roaring Twenties
runners.comment: 250,000gns yearling; each-way option, particularly if market vibes are positive
runners.spotlight: 250,000gns yearling; by Kingman; third foal; dam unraced half-sister to couple of Group/Grade 2 winners abroad; already gelded; each-way option, particularly if market vibes are positive; wears tongue-tie.

runners.name: Cardinal Point
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Cxxi And Partner
runners.comment: Letdown for Charlie Appleby/Godolphin last year; can't be supported
runners.spotlight: Two runs for Charlie Appleby/Godolphin last year; lost a match at 1-3 then finished nearer last than first (both 1m); changed hands for just 4,000gns in January; has joined an in-form yard but she can't be supported with confidence; ridden by 7lb claimer; goes without cheekpieces.

4:35.race_name: Barry Hills Further Flight Stakes (Listed Race)
4:35.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; 7.0)

runners.name: Al Qareem
runners.comment: Has won two Listed races, three Group races; French return should tee him up for a big run
runners.spotlight: Has won two Listed races, two Group 3 and a Group 2; never better than with his two wins over 1m4f last autumn but his staying form isn't that far behind it; made a fair reappearance when favourite in France three weeks ago and that should tee him up for a big run today.

quotes.race: BetMGM Cumberland Lodge Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: I tried not to fire Al Qareem out of the gates, but he naturally jumps quickly anyway and going into the first bend he was half taking me on. I've got a lot of confidence in him and the petrol gauge never really fades. He just keeps galloping. He tries so hard and you know he's going to give you 150%. Even on the wrong ground he finishes on the backsides of the leaders, but he loves it when the going gets soft - Clifford Lee, jockey

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Stand Cup Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Al Qarem ran really well and he's a great horse to own. Every time you think you're going to have a quiet spell, up he pops and he puts a smile on our faces. We had him in the Irish St Leger and at various times during this week I thought we were going to run in Ireland, but I'm happy with the decision to run here. We're planning to run him twice again this season and he has options at Newmarket in a couple of Listed races and then we'll look at something else - Nick Bradley, part-owner.

quotes.race: Jim Barry Cumberland Lodge Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: All Al Qareem does is gallop and he loves these stiff finishes. I always thought I was going to get back up because my lad tries hard and keeps going - Clifford Lee, jockey.

quotes.race: tote Stand Cup Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Everything went right and Sam James gave Al Qareem a great ride. I thought we were overpriced but you never know coming off a break like that how they're going to run. He picked up an illness when flying from Dubai which hit him pretty hard. We thought we might not get him back on the track this year but Karl has done a brilliant job - Nick Bradley, syndicate manager.

quotes.race: racingtv.com Handicap
quotes.quote: We thought Al Qareem would win and he's been crying out for a step up in trip. He'll come into his own this season and the form of his Kempton fourth last year has worked out amazingly - Nick Bradley, managing director of owners.

stable_tour.quote: He was pretty sick when he came back from Saudi Arabia and we nearly lost him but he recovered really well and won a Listed race and the Cumberland Lodge. We'd prepared him for the Further Flight at Nottingham but there's the Ormonde - 1m5Â½f round Chester would be perfect for him and it often comes up soft. 03-04-24

He was a huge improver last year with his handicap mark shooting up from 81 to 112 (31lb), which included victory in the Group 2 Prix Chaudenay (1m7f) under a cracking ride from Ryan Moore. We took him to Riyadh and Meydan earlier this year but he disappointed and I don't think the travelling suited him. He is having a break now and will be back for the second half of the season with the Ebor a likely target. 07-05-23

runners.name: Align The Stars
runners.comment: 1m6f win at Glorious Goodwood completed handicap hat-trick; gelded after two heavy defeats
runners.spotlight: Completed a handicap hat-trick last summer, the final leg coming from the front over 1m6f at Glorious Goodwood (good to firm); grim results in two strong Group races afterwards and he was gelded in December, but it's possible he can put that reversal of fortunes behind him.

quotes.race: Coral Summer Handicap
quotes.quote: Jason Hart galloped Align The Stars in July last year before he'd ever run and said he'll win the Ascot Gold Cup, and we're still bang on track.   He still hasn't really raced over a relentless mile and six furlongs and I think an emphasis on stamina in the St Leger is really going to take him to the next level. It will take another step up for him to be competitive, but I have enough faith in him that it's a realistic aim.  I think back to Subjectivist at the same part of his career and he went to the Leger and it was too sharp a test for him, but then he won a Group 1 in the Prix Royal Oak as a three-year-old - Charlie Johnston, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: Align The Stars is a huge horse who's bred to be top-class. We probably ran him more than we wanted to last year, chasing his Book 1 bonus. I've always hoped he would be a Group horse in time and I've not seen anything today that doesn't give me that confidence. If he went to Goodwood he'd have to come back to a mile and a half and Tony [Farmer, owner] is a big York man, so the Melrose has been on the radar for a long time - Charlie Johnston, trainer.

runners.name: Real Dream
runners.comment: Good first-time-out record, 3rd at Kempton 11 days ago on yard debut; not far away on that
runners.spotlight: Smart at his best at up to 14.5f on turf for Sir Michael Stoute; ended last term with two poor runs but, after a 30,000gns sale in October, he extended his good first-time-out record with 33-1 third of 14 in useful handicap at Kempton (1m3f) 11 days ago; not far away if that standard is repeated.

quotes.race: Ascot Racecourse Supports Children Heard And Seen Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a nice sensible gallop and once we've picked up into the straight Real Dream responded well. He's lightly-raced and hopefully he can continue going the right way. It's up to Sir Michael Stoute but I think the Ebor could be a race that suits him nicely - Richard Kingscote, jockey.

quotes.race: Unibet Extra Place Offers Every Day Handicap
quotes.quote: He stuck his neck out well. It probably turned into a bit of a sprint and then he had to respond. He's a very laid back character and takes his racing well - Richard Kingscote, jockey speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Divine Comedy
runners.comment: Off the boil last two starts; big player if straight back to her best in this new campaign
runners.spotlight: Raised her game markedly in both the last two seasons, last term including big runs in defeat on good to firm at Royal Ascot (2m4f) and the York Ebor meeting (2m); off the boil on last two starts but a big player if she's straight back to her best in this new campaign.

quotes.race: Betfred Nifty 50 Hell Nook Handicap
quotes.quote: I hadn't thought beyond today because two miles on this ground is a very different kettle of fish to two miles at Kempton but Divine Comedy loved the ground and the trip. The Ascot Stakes came to mind, black type will come into it at some point and the handicapper will have his say. Something like the Doncaster Cup could be a race for her down the line - Harry Eustace, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's been an absolute star but only once this year has she had her ground. She's in the Old Borough Cup and her main aim is the Irish Cesarewitch - on soft ground she could be very effective there. We thought about the Doncaster Cup but that's a bit too close to the Irish Cesarewitch. 11-09-24

She didn't run as a juvenile and has had three unplaced runs this season. I thought I would start off in modest company but the three maidens we have run in, at Wetherby, Newmarket and Yarmouth, proved to be hot races. She has been given a mark of 66, which I think is fair, and she'll be well suited to 1m2f and 1m4f. She's a big filly with scope to progress through the second half of the season. She'll act on quicker ground but would prefer some juice. 30-06-21

5:05.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; 7.0)

runners.name: Epimeteo
runners.comment: 10-11, won Chelmsford novice (1m2f, AW) in December by 4l, moving further clear at line
runners.spotlight: Close on debut at Brighton (1m, good to soft) in October; ran in two AW races later last year, ending as 4l winner of a novice when 10-11 at Chelmsford (1m2f) in December; well on top that day and was moving further clear at the line, so he brings promise under 5lb claimer on this handicap debut.

runners.name: Anglophile
runners.comment: Close 2nd from the front at Redcar (1m1f, soft) and Lingfield (1m2f, AW); handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Well held on debut but a close second from the front at Redcar (1m1f, soft) and Lingfield (1m2f, AW); better still should be forthcoming this season and he's one to consider on handicap debut.

runners.name: War Hawk
runners.comment: Steady run to justify 4-6 favouritism at Lingfield (1m2f, AW) eight days ago; 6lb penalty
runners.spotlight: Five races; shaped well on handicap debut at Wolverhampton (8.6f) last month and produced a strong, steady run to justify 4-6 favouritism in seven-runner handicap at Lingfield (1m2f, AW) eight days ago; he's one of only two who have runs this season and his 6lb penalty far from rules him out.

runners.name: Great David
runners.comment: Won at Brighton (1m, soft) on final 2yo start; handicap debut and looks set to stay 1m2f
runners.spotlight: Unlucky at Bath (1m, good) on penultimate start as 2yo, when he found lots of trouble, and got up close home in novice at Brighton (1m, soft) on final outing; makes handicap debut, having been on the rise when last seen, and he looks set to stay 1m2f.

runners.name: Sourdough
runners.comment: Useful pedigree and final run as 2yo was his best, when staying-on third in a 1m AW novice
runners.spotlight: Has a useful pedigree and final run as 2yo was his best, when staying-on third of 12 in a 1m novice at Lingfield on AW debut (after two runs in the mud); one to note on handicap/seasonal debut.

runners.name: Pinkarizon
runners.comment: 2nd on second outing (7.3f, heavy); early days, embarking on 3yo and handicap careers
runners.spotlight: Easily best of his three 2yo runs came when second of seven at Ffos Las (7.3f, heavy) on second outing; made the running on final start as well, when well beaten on soft; early days, embarking on 3yo and handicap careers.

runners.name: Manyana Blue
runners.comment: Placed on Fibresand all three starts this January-March, from the front on last two
runners.spotlight: Placed on Fibresand all three starts this January-March, from the front on last two occasions (1m/8.6f); hooded latest; should be suited by 1m2f+ and she has no fitness concerns on this handicap/turf debut.

runners.name: Gentle Warrior
runners.breeder: Irish National Stud Mare Syndicate II
runners.owner: Hambleton Racing Ltd Xxxv & E Burke
runners.comment: Ran away with five-runner C&D nursery (heavy) in October, in second-time visor; up 9lb
runners.spotlight: Made slow starts in most of his 2yo races but not on final outing when he ran away with five-runner nursery over C&D (heavy) in October, going on over 1f out in a second-time visor; gelded soon afterwards; his first four races were on good to firm/good, runner-up on fourth occasion but a move back from testing ground must be as big a concern as his 9lb rise.

runners.name: Darlas Secret
runners.comment: Lack of impact continued when second favourite for nursery (7f, AW); has left Seb Spencer
runners.spotlight: Outsider in three starts over 5f/6f last summer and his lack of impact continued when second favourite for nursery debut in September (7f, AW); has left Seb Spencer (same owners) and been gelded; also now wears blinkers and there are some stamina doubts on pedigree.

3:35.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; 7.0)

runners.name: Its Only Fun
runners.comment: Recorded a 5l win at Musselburgh last week on handicap debut; leading player
runners.spotlight: Had wind/gelding operations prior to 5l success at Musselburgh (1m1f, good) last week on handicap/seasonal debut, improving on his 2yo form; leading player under 6lb penalty.

runners.name: Lever Up
runners.comment: Final effort suggested this step back up to 1m will suit on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in two of his four starts last year; final effort suggested this step back up to 1m will suit on handicap debut; possibilities with progress plausible.

runners.name: Arcturus Flame
runners.comment: May be capable of improvement now handicapping in first-time headgear
runners.spotlight: Thrice-raced colt who has shown ability on AW and perhaps found 6f inadequate in sole turf attempt; may be capable of improvement now handicapping in first-time headgear.

runners.name: Bear Island
runners.owner: T G Roddick & W P Churchward
runners.comment: Interesting with improvement plausible on this faster surface; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Consistent 2yo season comprised a trio of fourth-place finishes, fading late on soft ground the final time (1m); gelded since; interesting with improvement plausible on this faster surface.

runners.name: Queen Of Good News
runners.comment: Best 2yo form when runner-up over 6f and 7f at Yarmouth; something to prove
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden who showed clear best 2yo form when runner-up over 6f and 7f at Yarmouth; always behind in 1m AW handicap final outing; something to prove.

runners.name: English Lady
runners.comment: Both 2yos starts on AW at Chelmsford; still unexposed and has a turf pedigree
runners.spotlight: Both 2yo starts on AW at Chelmsford, winning over 7f then creditable fourth over 1m; still unexposed and has a turf pedigree; could go well.

runners.name: Bownder
runners.comment: Ran well on AW last week, taking handicap record to 31221252; solid chance
runners.spotlight: Has form figures of 31221252 (turf/AW, mainly over 1m) since handicapping, most recently running well at Lingfield (1m2f) last week; solid chance off same mark returned to grass.

runners.name: Something Splendid
runners.comment: This switch to better ground may suit; debut for new stable
runners.spotlight: Not entirely solid on his 2yo form for Kevin Philippart de Foy but this switch to better ground may suit (well held on soft in both turf attempts); remains in same ownership.

runners.name: Mini Mac
runners.comment: Not certain to back up latest effort, having been inconsistent
runners.spotlight: Ran encouragingly over 7f on AW last time (second run for new yard) but isn't certain to back up that effort, having been inconsistent since his 6f novice win.

quotes.race: Download The Raceday Ready App EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C & D, No More Than 3 Runs) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Mini Mac loves the soft ground but hated the track. Had it been a more conventional course he'd have won it more cosily - Billy Loughnane, jockey.

runners.name: Dream Illusion
runners.comment: Possible improver in handicaps but the switch to turf presents a quandary
runners.spotlight: Thrice-raced filly who is bred to do well on AW and has duly shown some ability in that sphere; possible improver in handicaps but this switch to turf presents a quandary.

3:05.race_name: Ladies Day 10th May "Confined" Maiden Stakes (No More Than 2 Runs) (GBB Race)
3:05.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; 7.0)

runners.name: Fiery Dawn
runners.comment: Went close in a heavy-ground bumper and third in a 1m3f Southwell AW maiden; needs better
runners.spotlight: Went close in a heavy-ground bumper last March and showed some ability switched to the Flat at Southwell (1m3f, AW) in July/September, staying-on third last time; better is surely needed and this shorter trip may not help.

runners.name: Belaya River
runners.comment: 100,000euros yearling; fifth foal; Siyouni half-brother to two French winners
runners.spotlight: 100,000euros yearling; fifth foal; Siyouni half-brother to French winners She's Cosmic (1m3f; RPR 96) and Be The King (1m; 78); dam German 7.5f 2yo Listed winner (94), sister to Group-placed 6f-1m2f winner Cape Clear Island, out of Group-placed 1m4f winner; needs a market check on debut.

runners.name: Cameron Highlander
runners.comment: 16-1 third in novice at Newcastle (1m, AW) last month was against some talented rivals
runners.spotlight: 90,000gns yearling by Too Darn Hot, with useful pedigree; 16-1 when third of nine in novice at Newcastle (1m, AW) early last month, always in touch; that was against some talented rivals, so he brings the best form to this as well as promise.

runners.name: Just Adair
runners.comment: 25,000gns 2yo (October) by Ghaiyyath; late foal who is tongue tied for debut
runners.spotlight: 25,000gns 2yo (October) by Ghaiyyath; fifth foal; closely related to 6f AW winner Noble Consort (RPR 61), half-brother to Seeola (12.4f AW; 77) and a winner in South Africa; dam placed at 1m-1m4f (76), half-sister to Derby/Arc winner Golden Horn; late foal who is tongue tied for debut.

runners.name: Karthon
runners.comment: Third start; the step up in trip may well help but he needs a transformation
runners.spotlight: Plenty to like on pedigree but he showed modest form at Goodwood (1m1f, heavy; 9-1) in October and wasn't so good at Southwell (1m, AW; 8-1) 19 days ago; the step up in trip may well help but he needs a transformation.

runners.name: Munsif
runners.comment: Dam half-sister to Oaks/King George winner Taghrooda, (by this one's sire Sea The Stars)
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; half-brother to 7f winner Mubhijah (RPR 84); dam unplaced at 1m as 2yo (66), half-sister to Oaks/King George winner Taghrooda (by this one's sire Sea The Stars) and useful 1m4f winner Almoghared, out of 1m2f-1m6f Listed winner; makes debut but highly respected and needs a close look.

runners.name: Sea Of Kings
runners.comment: 250,000euros foal, by Sea The Stars; dam superb breeding record; late foal but one to note
runners.spotlight: 250,000euros foal, by Sea The Stars; fourteenth foal; brother to two winners including Sea Of Class (1m2f-1m4f including Irish Oaks; RPR 121), closely related to 1m-1m4f winner Love Is Golden (94), half-brother to ten winners, nearly all at least useful, including two Italian 1m2f Group 1 winners; dam 1m2f-1m4f winner; late foal but very much one to note.

runners.name: So Alex
runners.comment: 52,000euros yearling; dam's winners include Mango Tango (Group-placed 1m-1m2f; RPR 106)
runners.spotlight: 34,000euros foal, 52,000euros yearling, by Sottsass; eighth foal; closely related to winners Mango Tango (Group-placed 1m-1m2f; RPR 106) and Fierte D'Amour (French 10.5f; 93), half-brother to four winners; dam placed at 1m4f (88); newcomer from in-form stable.

runners.name: Typeface
runners.comment: Unraced for Godolphin, sold for 28,000gns; 66-1, no show at Southwell (1m, AW) last month
runners.spotlight: 280,000gns yearling; unraced for Godolphin and sold for 28,000gns last October; half-brother to winners Al Madhar (7f-1m2f; RPR 116), First Sight (1m-1m2f; 101) and Martinique (1m; 87); 66-1, no show in novice at Southwell (1m, AW) last month.

2:05.race_name: Flat Is Back Restricted Maiden Stakes (For Horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
2:05.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; 7.0)

runners.name: Dan Tucker
runners.comment: Ran a fine race at Redcar on his 2nd outing; less good on soft twice after; gelded; solid
runners.spotlight: Promise on debut and confirmed that when second of 17 at Redcar in September (6f, good to firm), travelling powerfully and not helped by the winner carrying him left in the closing stages; failed to build on that in two runs on soft ground subsequently (stiff task on former occasion), after which he was gelded; interesting back on faster ground.

runners.name: Nacho Nacho Nacho
runners.comment: 50,000gns half-brother to 5f-6f winner Solar Aclaim; yard's newcomers often better for run
runners.spotlight: 50,000gns yearling; second foal; half-brother to 5f/6f winner Solar Aclaim (RPR 94); dam placed 6f (71), half-sister to 7f 2yo Group 3 winner Alsindi; stable's newcomers usually better for a run but his pedigree makes him of interest.

runners.name: Storm Free
runners.comment: Useful form in defeat on AW last autumn; leading form claims back from 165 days off
runners.spotlight: Down the field at Newmarket on debut but he ran to a useful level in two Polytrack runs in the autumn, doing best of those held up when a beaten favourite at Chelmsford 165 days ago; solid claims back from a break.

runners.name: Cider Bob
runners.comment: Useful pedigree but didn't offer enough in two runs last summer to make him of interest
runners.spotlight: Two heavy defeats in 6f novice events on turf last summer; from a good family and likely to better at some point, perhaps when switched to minor handicaps.

runners.name: Luckie Lucas
runners.comment: Dam a 5f winner from a good sprinting family; fair standard to aim at on debut; hooded
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; dam 5f winner (RPR 87), sister to 5f winner Superior Edge, closely related to 6f Listed winner Bright Edge and to dam of Stewards' Cup winner Rex Imperator; bred to sprint but he has a fair standard to aim at on debut; wears a hood.

runners.name: Special Acclaim
runners.comment: Travelled nicely but failed to pick up on recent AW debut (6f); can do much better in time
runners.spotlight: Only fifth of eight on last month's Chelmsford debut (6f), unable to pick up for pressure in the straight; travelled quite nicely there though and he's a likely improver with that initial experience behind him.

runners.name: Woburn
runners.comment: 100-1 and little short-term encouragement at Wolverhampton three weeks ago (7f)
runners.spotlight: 100-1 and offered little in the way of short-term encouragement at Wolverhampton three weeks ago (7f).

runners.name: Yorkshire Myth
runners.comment: Two soft-ground runs last autumn, showing better form over 7f; bred to need more of a test
