runners.spotlight: Two soft-ground runs last autumn, showing better form on the second occasion when upped to 7f; open to further progress but he's bred for 1m+ and 6f on drying ground may not see him to best effect.

runners.name: Purpendicular
runners.comment: Seven of her eight siblings have won races; had wind op prior to her debut; best watched
runners.spotlight: Ninth foal; closely related to 7f 2yo winner Case Statement (RPR 82), half-sister to six winners including Envoy (1m-11.4f; 95), Poet's Prize (5f/6f 2yo; 94) and Poet's Lady (1m; 88); dam 1m2f/12.6f winner (65); she has undergone wind surgery prior to her debut; likely best watched.

runners.name: Sharp Call
runners.comment: Improving run by run on AW; further progress required to trouble principals on turf debut
runners.spotlight: Three runs at Southwell this winter, improving run by run and catching the eye of the stewards eight weeks ago (7f) when given a considerate ride in the closing stages (rider reported her to be green and rolling around in the straight); drop back in trip shouldn't be a problem but improvement is required if she's to trouble the principals on her turf debut.

5:35.race_name: Â£9 Racedays At Nottingham Racecourse Handicap
5:35.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; 7.0)

runners.name: Born A Rebel
runners.comment: Recorded sole win off 3lb higher last April; possibilities if back to that form
runners.spotlight: Record is 1-13, the success off 3lb higher at Yarmouth (1m, good) last April; possibilities if back to that form, with Chelmsford reappearance under her belt.

runners.name: Ballsbridge

prev_owners.owner: M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & Westerberg

runners.comment: Maiden who ended last season in a consistent vein of form; likely player
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden but ended last season in a consistent vein of form that featured two second-place finishes; likely player provided he picks up where he left off.

stable_tour.quote: We put blinkers on him at Navan as he had been very idle and lazy at home. I think he will improve a lot on what he did at Navan and I'd say you will see a different colt next time. 06-04-23

runners.name: Next Trick
runners.comment: Still a maiden but returns to turf off an attractive mark
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish maiden who has produced mixed results on AW for new stable; attractively weighted and hard to dismiss, being 8lb lower than for last turf appearance.

runners.name: Green Power
runners.comment: Capable of being involved but hasn't won on turf since 2019
runners.spotlight: Registered last five wins on AW, the most recent in January; remains in form and is well capable of being involved but hasn't scored on turf since 2019.

quotes.race: Chelsea Barracks Handicap
quotes.quote: That was a good performance by Green Power. We wanted to try him over five furlongs, so we decided to run him here and see how he got on. We have the Shergar Cup in mind for him next and he won at that meeting last year - John Gallagher, trainer.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Shergar Cup Sprint (Handicap)
quotes.quote: I've been trying to find a nice 6f race for Green Power. He had a good start to the season, but we'd been struggling to find a race for him on some nice ground, without it being rock hard. I think we found it today. I'll have a think and have a chat with the owners about plans, but he's progressive. He'll act on a lot easier ground as well. There's more to come from him - John Gallacher, trainer.

quotes.race: Bettinggods.com Quentin Franks Racing EBF Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: It was quick when Green Power made his debut but he's a big horse and I think he'll be better on soft. He'll make a cracking three-year-old sprinter, but I think there's more to come from him at two - John Gallagher, trainer.

runners.name: Double Red
runners.comment: Has a few pieces of form that suggest there may be an ordinary race in him
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden who isn't straightforward but has a few pieces of placed form that suggest there may be an ordinary handicap in him; not ruled out.

runners.name: Fat Gladiator
runners.comment: Interesting at this level; last attempt in Class 6 resulted in his sole win
runners.spotlight: Below-par favourite last time (second run back from long absence) but is interesting off a handy mark at this level; last attempt in Class 6 resulted in his sole win.

runners.name: Ring Of Gold
runners.comment: Attractively weighted but is 0-17 on turf and hasn't won on AW since 2022
runners.spotlight: Attractively weighted, even on best turf form; however, he's 0-17 in this sphere and hasn't won on AW since 2022; no certainty to take advantage of a reduced mark.

2:35.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; 7.0)

runners.name: Looking For Lynda
runners.comment: On a dangerous mark and should come on for last week's return; blinkers now tried
runners.spotlight: Operating off a reduced mark now and looked rusty on last week's seasonal return at Musselburgh, never threatening but plugging on late; this is the weakest handicap he has contested and he's of some interest with the run behind him and new blinkers enlisted.

runners.name: Ziggys Missile
runners.comment: Useful 5f form on AW; dangerous mark but still to prove as good on turf as AW
runners.spotlight: Made a flying start to his 3yo/handicap career, winning 5f events at Wolverhampton and Southwell (twice); went a bit cold afterwards but he was gelded last July and returned to action with a good second at Wolverhampton in November; hasn't built on that but he's down in the weights and this is an ease in grade; more to prove on turf.

runners.name: Counsel
runners.comment: Back in the groove dropped to 5f on AW this year; 0-11 on turf but fine on good or faster
runners.spotlight: Invigorated by the drop to 5f on AW this winter, winning Class 5 handicaps at Lingfield and Wolverhampton before coming up just shy in his hat-trick bid at Southwell; 0-11 on turf but fine on good or faster; should give it a good go back from a near eight-week break.

runners.name: Sugar Hill Babe
runners.comment: Disappointing the last twice and could prove vulnerable off this mark back on turf
runners.spotlight: She had been in good form on turf prior to winning a couple of 5f handicaps at Southwell in the autumn; her last two runs have been less convincing though and she may need some help from the handicapper.

runners.name: Spring Is Sprung
runners.comment: Two turf wins last June; feasible mark if ready to roll after 206 days off
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer; won twice on turf last June; has run well off this mark and worth a market check back from 206 days off.

stable_tour.quote: He's now won his last two at Pontefract and then at Lingfield last Thursday. His work has always been good and he finished fourth at York in a big-field handicap last season. But he then went wrong and we only ran him three times in all last year. He had to have time off and then he had a wind op during the winter. He's slowly run himself into form this season. Archie Young has won on him twice now and gave him an excellent ride at Pontefract. Both the horse and jockey had to be tough at Lingfield last time and they got the job done. I'd like to think there's be a little bit more to come from him. Whether he gets the hat-trick up depends on how good his trainer is. 28-06-24

runners.name: Mini Magna
runners.comment: One piece of form with Ziggy's Missile that gives him a good weights chance; inconsistent
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent for his new stable in 2024 but he ran a couple of good races in defeat, including a second to Ziggy's Missile at Southwell 13 months ago (17lb better off with that rival for under 2l); returns from a six-month absence; stable also run Dark Kestrel.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing HD Virgin 519 Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: He really is a little dude this horse. Mini Magna is tiny, but very tough, and he's definitely getting better with racing. He's the smallest horse I've ever trained but he must have a heart as big as his body - I'm really pleased for him. He's actually very well bred. We picked him up for 4,000gns but he has a lovely pedigree - it's not his fault he's small! - Ed Dunlop, trainer.

quotes.race: At The Races App Expert Tips EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Band D) (Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: He's well named anyway. Mini Magna is only a small thing, but he tries hard. He was good at the line, he's won a nice neck and he's got plenty of improvement to have - David Probert, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Dark Kestrel
runners.comment: Talented but not easy to win with; unlucky at Newcastle latest; 6lb lower mark on turf
runners.spotlight: Hasn't won as often as one with his raw ability should and his style of racing often leaves him a hostage to fortune; tanked through the race when third at Newcastle 18 days ago but by the time a gap appeared the principals were out of reach; rated 6lb lower on turf (was fine on good ground in his youth) and the harder they go early the better for him.

4:05.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; 7.0)

runners.name: Zarathos
runners.owner: J Sarkar, D Sarkar, O Sarkar & D Sarkar
runners.comment: Best when third on Southwell AW last two starts, handicap debut latest off today's mark
runners.spotlight: Best efforts when third on Southwell AW on last two starts, favourite in a nine-runner race for handicap debut last time (1m); off the same mark, he needs to build on that.

runners.name: Play Me
runners.comment: Best on debut; left George Boughey prior to this handicap/seasonal debut; also gelded
runners.spotlight: Third at Thirsk (1m, good) last August on debut but suffered a heavy defeat on Kempton next time and also below form at Wolverhampton (again 7f on AW); left George Boughey prior to this handicap/seasonal debut; also gelded.

runners.name: Whats She At
runners.comment: Redcar win (7f, good) last July; flop in Thirsk nursery (1m, good; made most) in September
runners.spotlight: Second on debut and went one better at Redcar (7f, good) last July; however, she needs to put her flop in a Thirsk nursery (1m, good; made most) in September way behind her.

quotes.race: Racing TV Free Trial EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Band D) (EBF Qualifier) (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: What's She At did it well in the end. She was very green. She travelled okay. She's going to be one who'll probably step up to a mile soon. She's got a nice bit of substance about her and a good attitude. She was going quite nicely when she hit the furlong pole and saw the fair on the left and she just jammed on. She'd never been in front before and I had to keep her up to her work - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

runners.name: Antiquity
runners.owner: P&H Moorhead, J Collins And S Piper
runners.comment: Mostly progressive on AW this year, including 1m wins at Lingfield and Newcastle
runners.spotlight: Mostly progressive on AW this year, including 1m wins at Lingfield and Newcastle; up another 4lb after scoring by a head last time but he has far more concrete claims than most in this field.

runners.name: Pistrucci
runners.comment: Best effort second start; fourth of five on handicap debut in September; gelded soon after
runners.spotlight: Best effort on second start; stepping up to 1m/9.4f since should have helped on pedigree but he was only fourth of five on handicap debut at Wolverhampton (AW debut) in September last time; gelded soon afterwards.

runners.name: Olivia Jane
runners.comment: Easily best on debut; hooded for handicap debut latest, upset in stalls and last at 40-1
runners.spotlight: Late foal who's had four runs on AW, easily the best of which was her second at Wolverhampton (7f) on debut; hooded for handicap debut five weeks ago, for which she got upset in the stalls and finished last at 40-1; no hood this time and she switches to turf, but questions to answer.

runners.name: Azoozi
runners.comment: Promise earlier but backward steps in his two handicaps; gelded since
runners.spotlight: Promise in maiden/novice company saw him sent off favourite for handicap debut at Kempton in January, only to finish in midfield; Southwell handicap (again 7f on AW) in February was rather worse and he's since been gelded.

runners.name: Lady Mariko
runners.comment: Fair form on first four starts but backward steps in her two races since; turf debut
runners.spotlight: Late foal; fair form on first four starts but she's made backward steps in her two races since, last of nine when trying 1m2f on latest; 6lb lower than on handicap debut; turf debut needs to spark a revival.

runners.name: Duke Orsino
runners.comment: Took a marked step forward when fourth of 11 in novice at Kempton (7f, AW) in December
runners.spotlight: Gelded after well beaten first two starts (turf); bred to do much better and took a marked step forward when fourth of 11 in novice at Kempton (7f, AW) in December; may well be capable of another on this handicap debut.

4:25.race_name: Taunton Round Table T-Rex Steaks Handicap Hurdle
4:25.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; 7.3)

runners.name: Hardy Du Seuil
runners.comment: Ran two fair races before struggling in the Imperial Cup; this is easier than that
runners.spotlight: Four wins under rules divided between fences and hurdles (on good and soft); kept to hurdles this campaign and ran two fair races before struggling in the Imperial Cup; this is easier than that.

quotes.race: Manor Elite Horse Boxes Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've got a few things to brush up with Hardy Du Seuil's jumping but I think he's a good horse. I think he's good enough to step into graded novice company, but the handicapper can't do too much with him so it could be another novice handicap for him first - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

quotes.race: Introducing Racing TV Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mr Ellison's horse is probably a three-miler and we didn't go very quick, which probably suited Hardy Du Seuil. We didn't learn anything at Wetherby, but we've learned a bit more there - Gavin Sheehan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He won a valuable handicap hurdle at Sandown in January 2023, but last term was a bit of a wash-out with a couple of niggly issues. He should bounce back this season. 06-11-24

He should have a nice handicap within his reach. We went chasing early with him, utilising his weight-for-age as a four-year-old, and he won a couple, but his jumping was a bit in and out, so we went back over hurdles last season. He won a decent prize at Sandown but chasing is the plan again and there's mileage in his mark. Two miles and soft ground is his bag, but I'm sure he'll stay further too. 28-09-23

runners.name: Mofasa
runners.comment: Has been disappointing this season but on a dangerous mark if he can stage a revival
runners.spotlight: Stable also runs Florencethemachine, the mount of Harry Cobden; this 9yo has been disappointing this season (under Cobden), twice over fences and back hurdling two months ago; on a dangerous mark if he can stage a revival.

quotes.race: Premier League Offers At Rhino.Bet Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mofasa ran very well and jumped nicely, but he missed the water jump at the point we were quickening up a little bit. He turned into the straight and quickened clear nicely. I had a challenge from Nico (de Boinville) on my outside, but he dug deep to win nicely in the end. I think he was always going to keep finding a little bit more. I think we have got to have a look at a good handicap with him as he has got that experience over fences now. Paul might run him in one more race like this, but at the same time you want to have a go at those good races when you have a decent mark - Harry Cobden, rider.

quotes.race: Ballymore Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Fences are going to be Mofasa's thing in time. He's had two quite quick races now, so ideally we'd probably like to give him some time and then make a plan around Christmas. He's such a big frame of a horse and it was probably a blessing we didn't run him in the spring when the ground was too quick. I think he'd like softer ground, but not deep ground, and while he's as light as he is, we don't want to pull him around too much on really soft ground. It looks like he's got plenty of toe, but he would stay further. He's done everything right so far and we've not had many novice hurdlers do what he's done. He's going the right way and has got to develop, but physically he looks the part and mentally he seems to have the right attitude for the job so hopefully he can keep progressing - Michael Scudamore, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Following a Huntingdon success on his second outing over fences, we found he was struggling with his breathing when down the field at Cheltenham, so we had his palate re-cauterised in December. Being a lean, light sort he never really got over the surgery and wasn't at his best in the spring. He runs well fresh, so we're going for the Badger Beer on Saturday without a prep run. He'll need to improve but I think he's capable of doing so. Wincanton's richest chase is among my favourite races at our local track and I've been lucky enough to win it 11 times. 04-11-24

He had just the one run last season when an encouraging effort saw him come home fourth at Ffos Las. I have given him plenty of time to develop and we brought him back at Uttoxeter in October where he ran out a seven-length winner. People were crabbing that form at the time but considering his subsequent effort when winning a novice hurdle at Cheltenham's last meeting, it looks a much better run. He has come out of his last run in great order and he could go to Sandown at the start of next month for a Graded novice hurdle, but I do not want to see that deep horrible ground they sometimes get there at this time of the year. That is the target, but I will not risk him on unsuitable ground. He has been given a rating of 134 and is clearly progressive. 21-11-22

runners.name: Tiny Tetley
runners.owner: R J Hodges & Mrs S L Hobbs
runners.comment: Beat three rivals last time but effectively 1lb lower with Callum Pritchard taking off 5lb
runners.spotlight: Consistent gelding who has won two handicaps this season from the front, over C&D (good to soft) and last time at Exeter (2m7f, good); beat just three rivals last time but effectively 1lb lower here with Callum Pritchard taking off 5lb.

runners.name: Florencethemachine
runners.comment: Chasing this season, winning the once; returns to hurdling off a competitive mark
runners.spotlight: Back from a break and her yard has won two of the last four renewals; has been chasing this season, making all to beat two rivals off 1lb lower at Exeter in November (3m, good); has won twice as a hurdler and should hold every chance.

quotes.race: DragonBet Best Odds Guaranteed Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: \BFlorencethemachine jumped moderately here the last time but she learnt an awful lot and when she schooled last week, she was very careful which was good to see. She loves that ground (good) so we'll keep her on the go while it's like it - Paul Nicholls, trainer talking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: She ran a solid race on her hurdling debut in a mares' event at Chepstow last month; she just got tired in the testing ground. She looks to have come on for the run and should win a similar contest soon. 05-11-23

3:55.race_name: Allaho ROR Ambassador Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
3:55.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; 7.3)

runners.name: Saint Bibiana
runners.owner: The Posh Pundit Racing Club Limited
runners.comment: Three-time hurdle winner but a remote third on her recent chase debut
runners.spotlight: Completed a hat-trick over hurdles last summer at about 3m2f (all on good ground); made chase debut only recently at Southwell (3m, good) and was a remote third, beating only one other finisher; will need to improve on that form.

runners.name: Another Day Out
runners.comment: Capable as she's shown during the winter but also comes with plenty of risk
runners.spotlight: Won back-to-back handicap chases during the winter (3m/2m4f; good to soft) but she's faded from the front the last twice and also refused to race in November; capable but seemingly comes with risks.

runners.name: Anytrixwilldo
runners.comment: Soft ground the last twice and ran well the last time he was on a good surface
runners.spotlight: 6lb higher when a close fourth at Hereford (3m1f, good) in November on just his second run over fences; below that level on soft ground subsequently but has to be of interest back under these conditions and over a trip that may suit (plenty of stamina in pedigree); cheekpieces added.

runners.name: Spotty Dog
runners.comment: In new blinkers when a rallying second over even further at Chepstow 20 days ago
runners.spotlight: 2lb out of the weights; he was 3lb wrong and didn't jump that well but stuck to his task to be second at Chepstow (3m6f, good) in the first-time blinkers 20 days ago; thereabouts with something similar.

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I got there a bit soon on Spotty Dog but I had to go as I had pressure. He enjoyed the fast pace and loves it around here - Liam Harrison, jockey.

4:58.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; 7.3)

runners.name: Game Line
runners.comment: Pulled up in his two starts (heavy/soft; visored both times) since a long absence
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in his two starts (heavy/soft; visored both times) since an absence of just over two years; old form suggests this better ground will suit but it still requires a leap of faith to support him in the added tongue-tie.

quotes.race: Snellings Norfolk National Handicap Chase (Fakenham Double Up Bonus Race)
quotes.quote: Game Line did that well, the further he goes the better he is. He hasn't finished out of the first three since he joined us and seems to go on any ground so we will enter him for the Summer Cup at Uttoxeter - Peter Bowen, trainer.

runners.name: Bumpy Evans
runners.comment: On a hat-trick and the step up in trip will suit; likely hard to beat under a 7lb penalty
runners.spotlight: Dual winning pointer at 3m last May (under Edward Vaughan) who's now on a hat-trick under rules, despite mistakes; rose to the occasion to give Alan Johns a send-off winner at Ffos Las (2m3.5f, good to soft) on Sunday; this tight track might not suit ideally but the step up in trip surely will and he's likely hard to beat under a 7lb penalty.

quotes.race: DragonBet Sponsors Alan Johns Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Bumpy Evans wasn't too bad on the way to the start but he wasn't very nice during the race. I didn't think I was going to win the whole way around and then to his credit he's very game at the business end - Alan Johns, jockey.

runners.name: Unspeakable
runners.comment: Good run here in November and yard had a big winner on Saturday; respected
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over fences but his second here (about 3m3f, good to soft) in November was up with his best and he also secured his only hurdle success at this track; may have just needed the run when fourth at Chepstow (2m7.5f, good) last month after an 80-day break; yard had a big winner at Aintree on Saturday and he should go well if this doesn't turn into too much of a speed test.

runners.name: School For Scandal
runners.owner: K Johns & Joe Tickle Racing Club
runners.comment: Won over C&D in November; bled last time but good chance he can bounce back
runners.spotlight: Often front-runs; likeable grey who's struck up a good partnership with Taylor Fisher, winning twice in the autumn including over C&D (good to firm) off 4lb lower; again ran well when second over C&D (good to soft) in January but pulled up at Huntingdon last time (bled); could bounce back with conditions in his favour.

quotes.race: South West Rail Solutions Ltd Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: School For Scandal is an absolute bunny, a real hero of a horse, and he's given me a lovely spin round every time. I just leave him alone, let him do his own thing and his breathing's a big thing when he's running. He got in a lovely rhythm round there and when one's come to him he's found a bit more so I was happy with that - Taylor Fisher, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Firefly Lane
runners.comment: Won at Newton Abbot in September; same mark, having been beaten 20l on last two starts
runners.spotlight: Sole success under rules came at Newton Abbot (2m5f, soft) in September but she was beaten about 20l on last two starts, last time weakening quickly over C&D in January; now back down to her winning mark, with Charlie Deutsch taking over, but comes with risks attached.

runners.name: Mcgregors Charge
runners.comment: Hard to weigh up on this stable/chase debut after 675 days away since placed in points
runners.spotlight: Nothing to show for three runs in handicap hurdles in the spring of 2022; eight subsequent starts in points yielded a second and third in 2023 when last seen; now makes his chase/stable debut having been off since June of that year; market check advised.

runners.name: Dreamsundermyfeet
runners.comment: Has been struggling for a while; now tried in other headgear from a career-low mark
runners.spotlight: 2-19 over fences, his second success coming at Huntingdon in November 2021; has been struggling for a while and the combination of market support, Sean Bowen and a career-low mark failed to spark a revival last time; dropped another 2lb and the blinkers replace other headgear.

quotes.race: John Southgate Memorial Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Dreamsundermyfeet was a bit flat at Worcester last time so we gave him a break and he's bounced back. It was a bit sharp for him around here but he toughed it out and he appreciated the good ground - Martin Keighley, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A very progressive horse who has done nothing wrong this season with form figures of 21131, which has seen his mark shoot up from 88 to 107 and I am sure there is more to come. We have a lovely team of youngsters this season who are coming through, which is a result of a lot of patience to let them develop thanks to supportive owners. He won following a break at Huntingdon last time despite the track being on the sharp side for him - in fact he was looking around a lot in the closing stages. There is a race at Southwell towards the end of the month that we are looking at next for him, as having won three races there it seems a logical target. He doesn't want the ground too soft and when it comes he will have a winter break. 24-11-21

2:55.race_name: "Who Dares Wins" Golden Ace Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Qualifier) (GBB Race)
2:55.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; 7.3)

runners.name: Rascallion
runners.comment: Made all at Wincanton; has more on his plate under a penalty but still respected
runners.spotlight: Inferior to Vaguely Royal on the Flat but has made a bright start over hurdles and it was his stable debut when making all for a narrow success at Wincanton (1m7f, good); looks to have more on his plate under a penalty but still respected.

runners.name: Vaguely Royal
runners.comment: Useful Flat horse; below par on final hurdle run but has good form claims in this company
runners.spotlight: Last of three on the AW last time but was a useful Flat performer for the Gosdens; below par on his final run over hurdles but first and second in two minor races before that and has good form claims in today's company.

quotes.race: Five-Rivers Fostering Doncaster Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I rode Vaguely Royal at Chepstow last time, we made the running and a combination of him still being green and getting lonely in front cost us the race. We were very confident coming here today, I just wanted to make sure I got a lead. William was going pretty steady in front, I wound him up in plenty of time but he won cosily. He's not a slow horse and I wouldn't see him getting much further than a mile and a half - Kieran Shoemark, jockey.

runners.name: Daisy Me Rollin
runners.comment: Beaten a long way in two good-ground bumpers and can only be watched now sent hurdling
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way in two good-ground bumpers and can only be watched now sent hurdling.

runners.name: Liberty Looming
runners.comment: Handicap mark bottomed out on the Flat and has finished tailed off in two novice hurdles
runners.spotlight: Handicap mark bottomed out on the Flat and has finished tailed off in two novice hurdles (hooded), the latest here (150-1).

runners.name: Nardaran
runners.comment: Ran a promising race at Kempton before struggling in a Listed race; tongue-tie added
runners.spotlight: Placed in one French run over 1m4f (very soft); made a positive stable/hurdle debut at Kempton before failing to fire in a Listed race at Musselburgh (again good to soft) when tried in cheekpieces; should be capable of better again and a tongue-tie is added.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him at the Arqana Sale in July after he'd finished third on his only start for the Aga Khan in a Saint-Cloud maiden. Already gelded, he came back into training later than the others but I already like what I've seen and I hope he'll be a valuable member of our juvenile hurdling squad. He could go for the juvenile event at Kempton the day after Boxing Day. He's in the mould of Afadil, an ex-Aga Khan Flat horse who was bought at the same sale. I hope Nardaran turns out as good. 04-11-24

runners.name: Offiahs Boy
runners.comment: Minor Flat form and a similar story thus far over hurdles; had a wind operation
runners.spotlight: Placed over 8.6f on the Flat but modest form, which has also been the case in his two runs over hurdles; no significance in the removal of headgear but he has had a wind operation.

runners.name: Saucats
runners.breeder: S A R L Ecuries Babsen Courses
runners.comment: Sketchy completion record in France and uncompetitive in two runs for David Pipe
runners.spotlight: Sketchy completion record in France and uncompetitive in two runs over hurdles for David Pipe (the latest after wind surgery); new trainer fits a hood but has a lot to prove now.

2:25.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; 7.3)

runners.name: Orchestra
runners.breeder: S C Ecurie Ades-Hazan & Pvp Racing
runners.comment: In fair form on the Flat of late; won over hurdles in November; new trip could suit
runners.spotlight: Off the mark over hurdles at Huntingdon (about 2m4f, good) in November; pulled up on soft next time but subsequently ran well on AW, in this headgear combination, in January; outpaced but a fair effort, after wind surgery, last month (again at Kempton over 2m) and now returns to hurdles over a trip he promises to stay; ran well when second on his only start here; chance.

runners.name: Myfanwys Magic
runners.comment: Hasn't backed up an encouraging reappearance in November but now 3lb lower
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden; three of his best runs came at Ludlow or Hereford, so this similar track should suit, but he hasn't managed to back up an encouraging November reappearance, weakening all four starts since, including in cheekpieces the last twice; 3lb lower than in November.

runners.name: Dino Magic
runners.owner: Mr And Mrs J D Cotton
runners.comment: Gave it a good go last time and now goes handicapping up in trip off a workable mark
runners.spotlight: Had wind surgery after both his bumpers last term; modest form in novice hurdles this season until doing his best to upset a 1-14 shot in an Exeter match (2m5.5f, good) last time; handicapper hasn't taken that form literally and he now enters this sphere up in trip off a workable mark.

stable_tour.quote: He's one of the 22 four-year-olds who were bought unraced at the sales and have come through their pre-training down the road from here with Will Biddick. He's one we like, judged on his work this autumn, and he ran okay at Ascot on Saturday, travelling like the winner as they turned for home before flattening out a bit. 05-11-23

runners.name: Lough Owel
runners.comment: Tailed off the last twice, after breaks of 119 and 180 days respectively
runners.spotlight: Won an Irish point and showed promise in the mud for Gordon Elliott in bumpers and maiden hurdles, at up to 3m, before ending up out of form with him last spring; tailed off on stable debut in September and again at Stratford (about 2m3f) last month, showing a bit more in the latter but he still has work to do.

stable_tour.quote: I have a feeling this is a nice Hillstar gelding. He won his point well and the second horse has since won a maiden hurdle for Emmet Mullins. 24-10-23

runners.name: Remember Moi

prev_owners.owner: The Posh Pundit Racing Club Limited

runners.comment: Step up in trip and better ground look positives for her handicap debut; interesting
runners.spotlight: Best effort in three qualifying runs came on her hurdles debut at Wincanton (2m5.5f, good to soft; Dino Magic third) in November, staying on for second albeit beaten 13l; ran on softer ground the last twice but this daughter of Jukebox Jury should be suited by this step up in trip on her handicap debut, with the quicker ground a likely plus too; yard was 4-9 over jumps last month.

runners.name: Basman Palace
runners.comment: Up 4lb and 4f having won last time; should be right in the mix
runners.spotlight: Up in trip and warm in the market when landing a first success 16 days ago, taking advantage of a reduced mark to score at Wincanton (2m4f, good); up 4lb and another 4f but the distance could eke out more and the forecast ground should suit; very much respected in his bid to follow up.

runners.name: Archie Macdart
runners.comment: Needs to do better but the cheekpieces go on; market check advised
runners.spotlight: Nothing to show for four starts since going handicapping, off 487 days before penultimate outing; quite lively in the market last time, though, and two of his dam's three winning siblings scored in first-time cheekpieces, which he tries today; it will be interesting to see if the money comes again.

runners.name: Inchagoill Lady

prev_owners.owner: Kevin Pickard, John Middleton & Edd Yeo

runners.comment: Pulled up on heavy the last twice; hopes pinned on wind surgery and better ground
runners.spotlight: All previous starts on softer than good; good efforts when third twice (over C&D and in a Wincanton chase) late last year but pulled up on heavy going in a chase and hurdle race the last twice; has undergone wind surgery and moves away from heavy going, both of which might help.

3:25.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; 7.3)

runners.name: Phoenix Risen
runners.comment: Won this two years ago and produced another solid run here a month ago
runners.spotlight: Won this two years ago and produced another solid run here when just behind Dirty Den a month ago (good); Chad Bament rides again with his 7lb claim and every chance of being involved; races prominently.

runners.name: Dirty Den
runners.comment: Runner-up here a month ago before not taking to fences; tries more new headgear
runners.spotlight: Behind Phoenix Risen at Wincanton in December but was just ahead of that rival when second here last month in the first-time cheekpieces; didn't take to fences last time and solid chance provided more new headgear doesn't backfire.

runners.name: Taritino
runners.comment: Latest front-running third here seems a fair reflection of where he is right now
runners.spotlight: Not far behind the top two here last month and probably ran to a similar level when a front-running third at the track two weeks ago (good); now 0-9 over hurdles (four Flat wins) but can't be discounted.

quotes.race: Betting.Bet Free Horse Racing Tips Handicap (Bath Summer Stayers' Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Joe (Tickle) said Taritino needs a bit of daylight and if he doesn't jump he can be tricky but he did jump. To be fair he was very free, I managed to get two breathers into him but when the other horse came alongside he lit me up again. It was a good effort considering. He'll probably get 2m - Hollie Doyle, jockey, speaking to Sky Racing.

runners.name: Kintaro
runners.comment: 21-race maiden under both codes and was well held in a seller last time at Exeter
runners.spotlight: 21-race maiden under both codes and was well held in a seller last time at Exeter (positively ridden); wouldn't be the obvious answer.

runners.name: Karakoy
runners.comment: Placed once over hurdles; soft ground an excuse last time but now back from another break
runners.spotlight: Best form yet over hurdles when just over 11l third at Newton Abbot (2m1f, good) and soft ground was a feasible excuse the last time, though that was after 184 days away and he now returns from another break.

stable_tour.quote: We've just got him off the Flat from Harry and Roger Charlton. He's a very nice four-year-old and he'll start in juvenile hurdles in the next four to six weeks. He's one we like a lot and I'm hoping he'll be competitive in a race this year. Whether he's got the ability to go to the Cheltenham Festival I don't know. 01-02-24

runners.name: Postponed Legacy
runners.comment: Lightly raced and ran well for a long way on handicap debut at Huntingdon
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced and ran well for a long way on handicap debut at Huntingdon (2m, good to soft), where he weakened into a 16l third; 3lb out of the handicap today (same as last time) but has the 4yo allowance and could last longer on this drier ground.

runners.name: Galactic Glow
runners.comment: Flat winner but a maiden hurdler; he's had his chances in handicaps and is 3lb wrong here
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-44 on the Flat and 0-10 over hurdles; outclassed in a novice last time but he's had his chances in handicaps and is 3lb wrong here.

5:30.race_name: BYD Taunton Open Maiden National Hunt Flat Race (Category 3 Elimination) (GBB Race)
5:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; 7.3)

runners.name: Big Boy Barney
runners.comment: Beat a useful sort in his Irish point; form of Warwick effort is also strong; respected
runners.spotlight: Beat a useful sort in his Irish point, then made the frame at Warwick in race won by Destination Dubai who subsequently ran well in Aintree Grade 2 last Saturday; the form pick.

runners.name: Calvino
runners.comment: Disappointing last time but is bred to do better still and can't be written off
runners.spotlight: Disappointing at Chepstow, failing to back up his Ascot effort, but is bred to do better still and can't be written off; first foal of a very useful hurdler/chaser for his stable.

runners.name: Ilostasock
runners.comment: Fitting of blinkers needs to make a huge difference
runners.spotlight: Beaten long way in both outings; fitting of blinkers needs to make a huge difference.

runners.name: Olivias Secret
runners.comment: Inauspicious debut in C&D event six weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Rank outsider in six-runner field over C&D (heavy) six weeks ago and ran accordingly for an inauspicious debut.

runners.name: Ivegotattitude
runners.comment: Tailed-off last at Hereford in sole start for David Evans
runners.spotlight: Tailed-off last of ten at Hereford 16 months ago in sole start for David Evans; best watched unless the market speaks positively.

runners.name: Play Nice
runners.comment: Debutante; related to a bumper winner but yard is 0-38 in bumpers
runners.spotlight: Debutante who is out of an unraced half-sister to bumper and useful hurdle/chase winner Busy Isit; however, yard is 0-38 in bumpers.

runners.name: Lootenay
runners.comment: Modest sixth at Huntingdon but may improve with that experience under his belt
runners.spotlight: Only a modest sixth at Huntingdon (good) but may improve with that experience under his belt; Sean Bowen, who has a respectable strike-rate for this stable, is a positive booking.

runners.name: Daring To Dream
runners.comment: Newcomer; yard is 0-12 in bumpers in last five seasons
runners.spotlight: Newcomer; first foal of an unraced mare whose siblings include Flat/hurdle winner Drusilla; yard is 0-12 in bumpers in last five seasons.

runners.name: Shes Our Last
runners.owner: Mrs V W Jones & B P Jones
runners.comment: Debutante; 1,000gns 3yo; stable has a low strike-rate in bumpers
runners.spotlight: Debutante; 1,000gns 3yo; half-sister to 1m2f/11.4f winner Thursday, out of 1m4f winner; stable has a modest strike-rate in bumpers.

1:48.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Maiden

runners.name: Butterfly Wings
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
runners.comment: Promise both 2yo starts at 1m; good chance she'll stay and Ryan Moore's choice
runners.spotlight: Justify filly is out of a half-sister to Giant's Causeway: encouraging enough debut in good-class 1m Leopardstown maiden last July but didn't improve on that when odds-on third in Salisbury novice following month under positive ride; upped in trip here, good chance she'll stay and Ryan Moore's choice.

runners.name: Catalina Delcarpio
runners.comment: 400,000gns Lope De Vega filly; respected source and any market support on debut noted
runners.spotlight: Lope De Vega filly a 400,000gns yearling; third foal; half-sister to French 1m2f/1m3f winner Grand Stars (including Listed; RPR 107); dam unraced half-sister to winners High Heeled (1m4f Group 3) and Bella Estrella (1m Group 3) and to dam of Irish 1,000 Guineas winner Just The Judge; respected source and market support on debut has to be noted.

runners.name: Etawa
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Kingman filly, top Aga Khan mid-distance pedigree; yard in hot form and respected on debut
runners.spotlight: Kingman filly is first foal of a Group 3-placed 1m winner (RPR 101), from top-class Aga Khan family of Oaks winners Ezeliya and Ebadiyla; yard has begun the season in hot form and debutante has to be respected.

runners.name: Own Your Day
runners.comment: Teofilo half-sister to 1m2f winner Ambitious Approach
runners.spotlight: Teofilo half-sister to 1m2f winner Ambitious Approach (RPR 79); dam modest maiden, from further family of Derby winner New Approach.

runners.name: Takemetothemoon
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
runners.comment: Didn't build on promising 2yo debut; potential remains but Moore prefers Butterfly Wings
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to five winners including the outstanding City Of Troy; dam won the Fillies' Mile and is a sister to Oaks winner Forever Together; promising Leopardstown debut in October over 7f but didn't step forward as anticipated at Dundalk 11 days later, fading quite tamely after a positive ride; potential remains but not sure if this trip is what she wants at this relatively early stage and Moore prefers Butterfly Wings.

stable_tour.quote: She had a couple of runs near the end of last season and was third and fifth but it looks like she's going to be a stakes filly. She's a lovely, good-moving horse who will get a mile and a quarter well. 07-04-25

runners.name: Tswalu
runners.comment: Luckless on sole 2yo start; more expected of this season but this could prove a hot maiden
runners.spotlight: Justify filly cost 400,000euros as a yearling; sister to Listed-placed 10.5f AW winner Shamwari (RPR 97), half-sister to US 6f AW winner Faithful Ruler; dam 6f AW winner (88), sister to 1m Group 2 winner Viscount Nelson; favourite, luckless debut at Cork in September, slow to break and meeting traffic problems when only sixth; much more expected of this season but this could prove a hot maiden.

runners.name: Two For Joy
runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
runners.comment: Outsider of the Ballydoyle trio and probably best watched with the future in mind
runners.spotlight: Wootton Bassett filly is first foal of a 9.5f winner (including Listed; RPR 111), herself a sister to Irish 2,000 Guineas winner Roderic O'Connor; debutante appears the outsider of the Ballydoyle trio and probably best watched with the future in mind.

runners.name: Cooleys Mist
runners.comment: Yard among the winners at the weekend so newcomer worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Churchill colt is first foal of a 7f/1m winner (RPR 86); yard among the winners at the weekend so newcomer worth a market check but this could be a hot maiden.

runners.name: Galaxy Wonder
runners.comment: Two moderate efforts, likely to be of more interest in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Two moderate efforts, likely to be of more interest in handicaps.

runners.name: Game Point
runners.comment: Strong-finishing Curragh second should relish this step up in trip; major claims
runners.spotlight: Blue Point colt shaped nicely on debut in good-class maiden here in October and following month improved when a strong-finishing second over 1m at the Curragh; shapes as though this trip will suit and likely major player.

runners.name: Gun Carriage
runners.owner: M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & P M Brant
runners.comment: Watching brief on belated debut with riding arrangements suggesting stablemates preferred
runners.spotlight: Gun Runner colt a $1,250,000 yearling; second foal; dam Graded-placed 6.5f-8.5f turf/dirt winner (RPR 108), half-sister to US 1m1f AW Grade 2 winner Chief Havoc; withdrawn due to ground (good) on intended debut last May and wasn't seen again; watching brief on belated debut with riding arrangements suggesting stablemates preferred.

runners.name: Jr Mahon
runners.comment: Respected source but this could prove a tough task on debut
runners.spotlight: Wootton Bassett colt a 28,000gns yearling and 38,000euros 2yo; third foal; half-brother to winners Hexameter (1m4f; RPR 84) and Solomon Coop (1m AW; 79); dam French Group-placed 9.5f AW 2yo/1m2f turf winner (102), out of half-sister to Irish Oaks winner Vintage Tipple; respected source but this could prove a tough task on debut.

runners.name: Keyboard
runners.comment: Midfield debut finish at Naas; marked step up in trip here and seems best watched
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; half-brother to stable's minor handicap winner Bosca Cheoil; dam unplaced; never better than midfield on last month's Naas debut (7f); marked step up in trip here and seems best watched.

runners.name: Kilcrea Rock
runners.comment: Promising second here last October; bred to appreciate this longer trip too
runners.spotlight: Plenty of juvenile promise in late-season maidens, second occasion just denied here over 1m when clear of the third (won this season); half-brother to smart 1m2f-1m6f winner Point King so good chance he'll appreciate this longer trip.

runners.name: Lombardi Trophy
runners.comment: Brother to stakes winners Circling & Easter Lily; Dante and Derby entries so respected
runners.spotlight: Galileo colt is brother to four winners inc Circling (US 8.5f stakes/1m2f; RPR 100), Easter Lily (7f 2yo/1m2f Listed; 99) and Sir William Bruce (7f-1m4f including Australia; 91); dam 6f 2yo Listed winner (103), half-sister to US 1m1f stakes winner Cherokee Reef; Dante and dual Derby entries so has to be respected.

runners.name: Roosevelt
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier/Michael Tabor/Derrick Smith/Peter M Brant
runners.comment: Ballydoyle second-choice on jockey bookings but worth a look for future reference
runners.spotlight: Frankel colt a 950,000gns yearling; closely related to 7f winner King Of War (RPR 77), half-brother to 9.4f AW/1m2f turf winner Naaey (92); dam Listed-placed 7f 2yo/1m winner (101), half-sister to 1m/1m2f Listed winner Drill; Ballydoyle second-choice on jockey bookings but yard has won last two runnings of this maiden with apparent second-choice.

runners.name: Stay True
runners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith
runners.comment: Galileo colt; Ballydoyle pick on jockey bookings, demands respect
runners.spotlight: Galileo colt a 400,000gns foal; third foal; half-brother to 6f winner Minnie Wildes (inc AW; RPR 82); dam Listed-placed 6f AW 2yo winner (100), half-sister to Group-placed 7f-1m2f winner Queen Of Time; Ballydoyle pick on jockey bookings, demands respect.

runners.name: Dutch Gold
runners.owner: Albert Dravins & Exors Of The Late Eamonn Scanlon
runners.comment: Both Flat wins at this trip but they've come on softer ground and may find this sharp
runners.spotlight: Sixth behind Kopek Des Bordes in a maiden hurdle at Leopardstown when last seen on St Stephen's Day; both Flat wins at this sort of trip but they've come on softer ground and he may find this test sharp enough on return.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Median Auction Maiden
quotes.quote: Dylan Browne McMonagle rode DUTCH GOLD last time over a mile and we were thinking about going back to 7f but he said he needs a trip. I was worried about the ground but he seemed to like the ground and the trip. He had some very good runs as a two-year-old and we were getting a little bit frustrated so that was nice to get. I had a notion we were going to geld him after today's race but we might leave him now as he settled well - Noel Meade, trainer.

runners.name: Cheeky Wink
runners.comment: Gowran maiden winner and good runs in defeat since but career best needed on return
runners.spotlight: Gowran maiden winner second time out and some creditable runs in defeat since including a second to Hello Neighbour at Roscommon in October; career best required on return to defy this mark.

runners.name: Himalayan Heights
runners.comment: 1m4f Tipperary winner last term before narrow defeat at Galway; below form twice since
runners.spotlight: Won over extended 1m4f at Tipperary early last season before a narrow defeat at the Galway Festival; well below form twice since and probably needs a bit further; gelded.

quotes.race: "Domin OH HOO HOO" Handicap
quotes.quote: Himalayan Heights is a massive, beautiful big horse. He was just a little bit raw and immature last year and we thought that [the gelding operation] would do him the world of good, between that and growing up. Hopefully there's a nice pot in him somewhere along the line - Ger Lyons, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Racing Again On July 2nd At Tipperary Maiden
quotes.quote: Himalayan Heights is a big horse and Colin said he didn't enjoy that ground either. He wants just a nice ease. He is an autumn horse and is definitely a next year horse - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Instant Appeal
runners.comment: 3rd in City Of Troy's maiden; Gowran maiden winner; missed all 2024; new trip may suit
runners.spotlight: Hit the crossbar on debut before a third in City Of Troy's maiden success at the Curragh in July 2023; no surprise he made easy work of a 7f Gowran maiden on only subsequent start; missed all last season but this new trip should suit and gelded in the interim; could be ahead of this sort of mark if fit.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: I got a handy lead and Instant Appeal had a bit of experience on his side, I liked the way he picked up and he hit the line well - Scott McCullagh, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He won his maiden well at Gowran Park and has done very well over the winter, we're delighted with him. We'll be waiting for some nice ground before we get him out. 24-04-24

runners.name: Shemozzle
runners.comment: Won sole 2yo start; added fillies' h'cap success before some low key runs; tough draw
runners.spotlight: Won sole 2yo start and added a fillies' handicap success at Lingfield (1m1f, good to firm) when making all; subsequent runs for Ralph Beckett were below her best and she has a tough draw to defy here.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Ralph [Beckett, trainer] was keen to make sure I'd make use of Shemozzle and she kept on rolling. I thought I gave her a good ride from the front - Hector Crouch, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: racingtv.com Fillies' Restricted Novice Stakes (For Horses In Bands B/C/D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It wasn't a big surprise, Shemozzle has always been a professional sort of filly like her mum. She'll have a nice holiday now, we'll bring her back in the spring and work our way through the grades I hope - Ralph Beckett, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Slieve Binnian
runners.comment: 5-23; four wins on AW; respectable close 4th latest over 1m4f but mark looks a bit high
runners.spotlight: Solid record of 5-23, four of those wins on AW; met some interference when a close up fourth at Dundalk (1m4f) last time; handicap mark probably high enough back on turf for new yard and drawn wide returning from 124 days off.

quotes.race: Gateway Hotel Dundalk Race & Stay Handicap
quotes.quote: Slieve Binnian did that well. He jumped and travelled and hit the line well, he is definitely on the up. He jumps quick and you can put him anywhere in a race - Ronan Whelan, rider.

quotes.race: Holden Plant Rental Handicap
quotes.quote: Slieve Binnian was in such good form all week that I let him take his chance. He's a lovely, gebuine horse and that's a good trip for him - Michael Halford, joint trainer

runners.name: Pepper Noir
runners.comment: All 3 wins on AW; up 7lb for latest success but drawn well for her preferred tactics
runners.spotlight: All three wins have come on AW at Dundalk; won back-to-back over 1m4f prior to two low-key hurdle efforts; up 7lb for latest win in this sphere but well drawn for her preferred prominent tactics and has a chance.

quotes.race: Floodlit Fridays At Dundalk Handicap
quotes.quote: Pepper Noir enjoyed going the trip, she travelled better and actually picked up well. I think we will be sticking to this trip and hopefully there is more to come - Gary Carroll, rider.

runners.name: Quatre Bras
runners.comment: Sole win at 7f on AW; modest start for new yard but quicker ground and new trip may help
runners.spotlight: Sole win for Jane Chapple-Hyam came over 7f on AW and modest start for this yard when last of 15 at Naas earlier in the year; quicker ground should help and new trip could too.

runners.name: Ozark Daze
runners.comment: 0-11 but knocking on the door for Andy Oliver when last seen; may need this on yard debut
runners.spotlight: 0-11 but he was knocking on the door for Andy Oliver on AW when last seen; could give a good account if fit but stall 17 is far from ideal and may need this on yard debut.

runners.name: Sacred Oath
runners.comment: Won at 7th attempt in AW maiden; didn't settle on h'cap debut latest
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the seventh attempt in a Dundalk maiden but didn't settle when a close up fourth on handicap debut; mark may be stiff enough for now.

runners.name: Solar Breeze
runners.comment: Losing run since 2023; holding form well on AW lately; may be vulnerable
runners.spotlight: Losing run since 2023 but holding her form well on AW lately; at her best when she gets a good pace to aim at, which looks likely here but form of her recent Dundalk third has taken a few knocks and may be vulnerable to better treated rivals.

runners.name: Expound
runners.comment: Caught late when beaten 1l here last week; will relish step back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Only caught late when beaten 1l here last week; will relish the step back up in trip and Sheridan takes over from a 10lb claimer; leading claims with the prospect of him coming on for his return.

quotes.race: Peter Queally Memorial Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Expound has plenty of ability and it's good the way he can mix it between both [codes]. When he won his [Flat] maiden he made the running and Denis [Hogan, trainer] said to keep it simple, he likes to make the running and let the horses try and catch him. He was very good from the front, jumped really well and travelled and when they came to him he picked up and done it nicely in the end - Daniel King, jockey, speaking to RTV.

runners.name: Pralognan
runners.comment: Arrives on back of 2 respectable hurdle runs; in good form on AW when last seen on level
runners.spotlight: Arrives on the back of two respectable efforts over timber and was in good form on AW towards the end of last year; return to this sort of trip will help, although best turf form has come on softer ground.

runners.name: Migdam
runners.owner: Dooley Thoroughbreds & J Fairhurst & Paul Riley

prev_owners.owner: Dooley T'breds & Shamrock T'breds & B T O'Sullivan
Dooley Thoroughbreds & J Fairhurst & Paul Riley
Dooley T'breds & Shamrock T'breds & B T O'Sullivan
Dooley Thoroughbreds & J Fairhurst & Paul Riley

runners.comment: Hinted at return to form lately and respectable 6th last week; return to further will help
runners.spotlight: Hinting at a return to form of late and was only beaten roughly 2l here over 1m last week; return to further will help and he's down to a career low handicap mark so not without claims.

runners.name: Ard Na Mara
runners.owner: Mrs J S Bolger & James Peter Dowling
runners.comment: Punchestown maiden winner; 4th of 20 over C&D when last seen but drawn wide this time
runners.spotlight: Followed up a maiden win at Punchestown with two respectable efforts on more testing ground in handicap company, including C&D fourth of 20 latest; return to quicker ground should help but drawn wide.

runners.name: The Real Screamer
runners.comment: Bids for hat-trick after back-to-back AW wins but up 11lb for latest and wider than ideal
runners.spotlight: Arrives bidding for a hat-trick after back-to-back wins over Dundalk's extended 1m2f; 11lb rise for the latest success may halt the winning run though and drawn wider than ideal over this C&D.

runners.name: Out On Friday
runners.comment: Lost his way when last seen including over C&D last time out; drawn wide; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; lost his way when last seen including over C&D last time out; drawn wide; engaged at Navan on Tuesday.

quotes.race: Ardmore Handicap
quotes.quote: Out On Friday was stepping back in trip, which suited him as all he does is stay. He loves to get his own way in front and can go on any ground - Sean Bowen, jockey, speaking on Racing TV

quotes.race: BOYLESPORTS Supporting Irish Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: Out On Friday got a lovely ride from Killian. He has come back to form and you have to take the opportunities when you get them. There's a race at Galway next month which might suit him - Philip Byrne, trainer.

quotes.race: Caulfield Industrial Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Out On Friday is a tricky ride and has his own ideas. He didn't like going left-handed at Leopardstown last week and loved going right-handed here. He's in again on Sunday and we might take our chance - Philip Byrne, trainer.

runners.name: Rain
runners.comment: 1-25 and sole win came over 1m6f; struggled towards back end of last season; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; 1-25 and sole win came over 1m6f; struggled towards back end of last season; new yard; engaged at Navan on Tuesday.

3:18.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Median Auction Maiden

runners.name: Alakazi
runners.breeder: H H The Aga Khan's Studs
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Not discredited on sole 2yo start in hot late-season maiden here over 7f; more expected of
runners.spotlight: Footstepsinthesand colt; dam maiden half-sister to winners Alashar (French Listed-placed 7f turf 2yo/9.5f AW) and Alanannda (7f); not discredited on sole 2yo start in hot late-season maiden here over 7f; more expected of.

runners.name: Desmond Castle
runners.comment: Disappointed on soft here final 2yo start; place claims however back on better ground
runners.spotlight: Best effort came on nursery debut when beaten 1/2l at the Curragh; laboured effort when favourite here on final start (soft) and has been gelded since; return to quicker ground may suit and not one to rule out.

runners.name: If I Was You
runners.comment: Newcomer likely all the better for the experience
runners.spotlight: Ulysses gelding a 35,000euros yearling; brother to 1m2f turf/1m4f AW winner Knockbrex (RPR 93), closely related to a winner abroad by Intello; dam unraced half-sister to 1m2f/12.5f Listed winner Answered; newcomer likely all the better for the experience.

runners.name: Jet Warrior
runners.comment: Related to some useful types; market likely best guide on debut
runners.spotlight: Saxon Warrior colt; cost 27,000gns as a foal; half-brother to four winners including Connemara Coast (7f-1m1f including 2yo/AW/HK; RPR 94) and Poppy's Boys (US 5f-8.5f turf including 2yo); unraced dam out of French Oaks/Moulin winner; market likely best guide on debut.

runners.name: No Such Thing
runners.comment: Dundalk comeback run encouraging; step up in trip should suit and big player
runners.spotlight: Solid debut second at the Curragh last May; disappointed at same venue in September but more like it on last month's return when staying-on third behind a smart type on AW at Dundalk; step up to 1m here is likely to suit; major claims.

runners.name: Some Performance
runners.comment: Irish 2,000 Gns entry and won't need to improve too much on 2yo form to play major role
runners.spotlight: Decent form on both outings within three weeks last October, speed throughout when a close fourth at the Curragh and then not clear run in weaker Dundalk contest when beaten 2l; Irish 2,000 Guineas entry and won't need to improve too much to play a major role.

runners.name: Voice Of Northeast
runners.comment: Good bit of improvement needed on Dundalk runs; more likely one for handicaps
runners.spotlight: Good bit of improvement needed on Dundalk runs; more likely one for handicaps.

runners.name: Wertpol
runners.comment: Never sighted when a 25-1 shot on last month's Naas debut; likely to need more time
runners.spotlight: Never sighted when a 25-1 shot on last month's Naas debut; likely to need more time.

3:48.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Heritage Stakes (Listed Race)

runners.name: Mutasarref
runners.comment: Dual Group 3 winner here last season; the one to beat if handling fast ground
runners.spotlight: Stable stalwart the winner of 10 of 22 races including twice at Group 3 level here last summer and C&D Group 2 second arguably better form; ended season winning Cork Listed; has never raced on ground this quick but goes on any other; carries a penalty but still probably the one to beat.

quotes.race: Bahrain Turf Club Desmond Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: You don't expect to be winning these races with the penalties. We were a bit disappointed with Mutasarref last time at the Curragh, but that's the Curragh. I don't think he's ever run his best race there but he does it here. You think the penalties are going to stop him and he just keeps doing things like that. Horses like him make you enjoy the game. The plan is to come back here on Champions Weekend for the Group 2 Boomerang Stakes, which is beyond him, but it will give us another day out - Ger Lyons, trainer.

quotes.race: Owenstown Stud Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Mutasarref came back from an injury and as Colin said he's back to himself. That's his grade and seven furlongs is his trip. A mile is just a tad beyond him - Ger Lyons, trainer.

quotes.race: Bahrain Turf Club Knockaire Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Mutasarref has been on the wane all year but the ground here helped his old injuries and his old bones. He has been a very lucky horse for us and on his day he is still a good horse - Ger Lyons, trainer.

quotes.race: Hollywoodbets We're Painting Ireland Purple Handicap
quotes.quote: Mutasarref is a stakes horse in a handicap. I don't know if he's a Group 3 but he's definitely a Listed. We'll go to Champions Weekend with him now - Ger Lyons, trainer.

quotes.race: Jet & Peggy O'Carroll Memorial (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Mutasarref looked like he should go and win today. We'll look for a handicap for him. We thought he would handle the ground well and he did - Kris Weld, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Lord Massusus
runners.comment: C&D Group 3 winner two years ago; all the better for last month's comeback run; respected
runners.spotlight: Pick of six wins when winning Group 3 over C&D in 2023 and last season when landing Curragh Listed over same trip; keen, didn't feature on last month's Curragh return but a much more forward showing expected here.

quotes.race: Bahrain Turf Club Desmond Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Lord Massusus disappointed last day but things didn't go right. We got him switched off today and he came home like a good horse. It was a good performance - Joe Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: The Dillon Marshall Property Consultants Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: We'll make an entry for the Jersey Stakes now, seven furlongs would be ideal - Joe Murphy, trainer of Lord Massusus

quotes.race: Irish EBF Auction Series Race (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Lord Massusus put up a very good performance and I think he's a good horse. That qualifies him for the final at Naas next month. He did what good horses do today - Joe Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Premier Nursery Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Lord Massusus was very straightforward and travelled well. He's plenty green, around here it's a tight enough track, but when I squeezed him he picked up and when he hit the front he pricked his ears and won with a little left. Hopefully he'll keep improving, he got the trip well. He's got a bit of scope and will make a nice three-year-old - Gary Carroll, jockey.

runners.name: This Songisforyou
runners.comment: Drop back in trip possibly not ideal on seasonal return and has a bit to find
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 7yo at his best when winning 1m2f Curragh premier handicap last September; fortnight later didn't count in Cambridgeshire; drop back in trip possibly not ideal on seasonal return and has a bit to find.

runners.name: Bluedrum
runners.comment: Lightly raced 4yo; cheekpieces now tried on return with still potential for more
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo won Naas 2yo maiden and solid form at stakes level in first half of last season, notably second in Group 3 here (7f) and final start when staying on fourth in Group 3 at Deauville over today's trip; cheekpieces now tried on return with still potential for more.

stable_tour.quote: She was very impressive over seven furlongs on debut at Naas. She was meant to go to Leopardstown the other day but the ground was too soft. She'll go to the Athasi Stakes at the Curragh and she's entered in the Irish 1,000 Guineas. I think she'll stay a mile well. Her dam, Drumfad Bay, stayed it well. 24-04-24

runners.name: Thalara
runners.comment: Just fourth career start here so potential for more but big ask
runners.spotlight: Mare having only her fourth career start here, having won 1m1f Gowran maiden last summer but too keen and didn't stay in 1m2f Dundalk Listed three months later; connections keen to persevere so could still have improvement in her but this looks a big ask.

runners.name: Uluru
runners.comment: Conditions to suit and has her chance given the fillies' allowance
runners.spotlight: Gowran 2yo winner for Kevin Coleman but 0-7 for current yard, smart level of form though when third in Sandringham (1m, good-to-firm) at Ascot and second in Deauville Group 3 (1m2f) last summer; not at best final start on heavy ground; conditions to suit and has her chance given the fillies' allowance.

stable_tour.quote: She ran well on her debut for us in the big sales race at Naas. She'll go to Killarney on May 14 and we think she's a stakes filly. 23-04-24

runners.name: Proleek Prince
runners.comment: Outpaced when dropped to 7f for first time on AW last month
runners.spotlight: Was outpaced when dropped to this trip for the first time at Dundalk last month; will be of more interest when returned to further.

runners.name: Desert Haven
runners.comment: Struggling over timber and same story when last seen on Flat; 7f on quick ground too sharp
runners.spotlight: Struggling over timber in recent times and it was a similar story when last seen in this sphere; 7f on this ground probably too sharp for him.

quotes.race: SPIN1038 Handicap
quotes.quote: Desert Haven's last two runs last season were disappointing but he was getting a little raspy of his wind and we did a little job on it and I'd say it helped him a bit. Colin (Keane) is adamant that he's better on a turning track so you'd imagine Galway could come into the equation at some stage - Noel Meade, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Pier Pressure
runners.comment: Dual 7f on AW in 2023; added 1m success at Gowran last term; drawn widest
runners.spotlight: Dual 7f winner on AW in 2023 and added a 1m success at Gowran last term; below last winning mark but tends to need his reappearance outings and he's drawn widest here.

quotes.race: Gateway Hotel Dundalk Race & Stay Maiden
quotes.quote: Pier Pressure travelled into it nicely, He was still green and had a good look when he got there but he won snug enough - Jack Kearney, rider

runners.name: Comfort Line
runners.comment: Productive winter on AW; stayed on well over this trip to score latest; up 5lb
runners.spotlight: Has enjoyed a productive winter on AW, winning three times at Dundalk since November and best run for a while when staying on well over this trip at Dundalk to score by half a length latest; on his highest mark for some time but still feasibly treated on old form and he arrives in better form than most of his rivals here.

quotes.race: Gift & Art Gallery Dundalk Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Comfort Line ate up this morning, did a half-hour on the beach this morning and we decided we had nothing to lose. He's solid and a good fun horse, when he comes back down to this sort of grade he wins - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

quotes.race: www.navanracecourse.ie Handicap
quotes.quote: The handicapper gave Comfort Line a bit of a chance by dropping him a few pounds. I was a bit disappointed at Galway when he had an outside draw and didn't get a chance. He was coming back to form and, all being well, he'll run in the Cambridgeshire in a couple of days. I used the cheekpieces on him (when second) in the Lincoln earlier this year and had been kind of saving them until he was back where I thought he'd be - Mick Mulvany, trainer.

quotes.race: PWC Kilkenny Handicap
quotes.quote: He's a horse I always thought would make up into a nice horse and I think he'll make a far better four-year-old. He's very big and he's filling into his frame. The Irish Lincoln is the plan for him. You'd be hopeful he'll turn into a Lincoln horse - Mick Mulvany, trainer

quotes.race: LimerickRaces.ie Maiden (Div I)
quotes.quote: Leigh Roche came in the last day and said he just didn't stay the mile and a quarter. I always thought he'd be a nice horse and still think he'll get a mile and two furlongs, but he's still only maturing into a horse. He's a big frame of a horse and the breed of them only get better as they get older. You'd be hoping he'll develop into the type of horse we think he is. We'll probably go to Galway after this for a three-year-old race. I'd blame myself for the last few runs and last time we found out for sure he didn't stay a mile and a quarter yet. Gary [Carroll] said today that he felt the horse was idling in front so hopefully he can keep progressing - Mick Mulvany, trainer of Comfort Line

runners.name: The Bear Trap
runners.comment: Off the mark at 18th attempt with 7f maiden win when last seen; stiff mark back in h'cap
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 18th attempt with a 7f Dundalk maiden win when last seen in December; probably on a stiff enough mark back in handicap company and he's been off 117 days.

stable_tour.quote: A nice colt who runs in the opener at Navan on Saturday but will improve on whatever he does there. 21-04-23

runners.name: Enchanted Garden
runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late Sir Robert Ogden
runners.owner: Ms Olive Walsh & Mrs Paul Shanahan
runners.comment: Two from six and scoped badly when disappointing in hat-trick bid latest; respected
runners.spotlight: Followed up an AW success on handicap debut with a C&D win from 9lb lower mark than this; scoped badly when disappointing in her hat-trick bid when last seen; winning return last season so not ruled out despite 230-day absence.

runners.name: Moyassr
runners.comment: Lost maiden tag in 1m AW h'cap; mixed signals on that form; 7lb higher back in h'cap
runners.spotlight: Lost the maiden tag in a 1m AW handicap in November; mixed signals on the strength of that form and he's up 7lb; suspicion he'll need this on return with first-time tongue-tie fitted.

runners.name: Morning Approach
runners.comment: Turf win here in 2022; wide margin AW winner this winter and paid the price with her mark
runners.spotlight: Sole turf win came over 1m here in 2022; still paying the price for a wide margin AW win from a handicapping perspective and probably needs further than this these days.

quotes.race: Gateway Hotel Dundalk Race & Stay Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought Morning Approach ran a lovely race here the last day over 1m2f where things didn't work out as they went no pace up front and they all quickened up the straight and it didn't really suit her. They went a nice pace here and she had a target which helped her. She likes good ground and a level track - Willie McCreery, trainer, talking to RTV.

quotes.race: Racing With Pride Handicap
quotes.quote: Morning Approach is a good little filly. She ran well in handicaps last year but she is just stronger this year. She is a big filly and needs a big galloping track - Willie McCreery, trainer

runners.name: Port Louis
runners.comment: Sole win came 2 years ago and out of form on AW lately
runners.spotlight: Roscommon maiden winner in May 2023; encouraging run over this trip at Fairyhouse last season but struggling on AW this winter.

runners.name: Red Hugh Odonnell
runners.comment: 2nd in Tipperary maiden but not at same level since; blinkers now tried on h'cap debut
runners.spotlight: Hit crossbar in 5f Tipperary maiden last summer but not at the same level in three maidens since; first-time blinkers need to have dramatic effect for him to get off the mark on handicap debut.

runners.name: Tawaazon
runners.comment: 8 wins; none since 2023; tends to prefer it softer and poor record fresh
runners.spotlight: Eight wins to his name but none since 2023 and tends to prefer softer ground than what's likely here on turf; poor record fresh and best watched for now; off 197 days.

runners.name: Imperial Fighter
runners.owner: Patrick J Mckenna/Nigel Ohare/Kabin Racing Syndicate

prev_owners.owner: Jim And Claire Ltd And Jon & Kay Collins

runners.comment: Group 1-placed in his pomp; best recent form over further; behind Comfort Line latest
runners.spotlight: Group 1-placed in his pomp; best recent form has come over further than this and work on to reverse form with Comfort Line from last time; drawn wide.

runners.name: Roman Harry
runners.comment: Sole win came at Laytown; step back in right direction when 2nd in claimer latest
runners.spotlight: Sole win came on the beach at Laytown last year; step back in the right direction when runner-up in claimer 12 days ago; needs to build on that back on turf.

runners.name: Half Nutz
runners.comment: Only beaten half a length in Dundalk claimer when last seen in January; new yard
runners.spotlight: Only beaten half a length in a Dundalk claimer when last seen in January; modest record fresh and needs a pace to aim at but workable mark if fit on yard debut.

quotes.race: William Hill Pick Your Winners Handicap
quotes.quote: Half Nutz is very straightforward but it just didn't fall right for him a few times. I was very happy with the way he ran in Listowel, he didn't get much of a run there. He's a horse that has to be ridden for luck, it didn't happen in Listowel but it happened today - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

quotes.race: Weatherbys GSB Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: We tried him over five and Wayne got off him the last day and said this was his trip. He's improving. Last year he was running a bit free and just a bit hard on himself but now he's as sweet as a nut. We could try him over seven now if something comes up as he's much easier to ride - trainer Sheila Lavery.

runners.name: Jurality

prev_owners.owner: Straight To Victory Syndicate/Geoffrey Thorpe/Brian Bunyan
Straight To Victory Syndicate, Geoffrey Thorpe & Brian Bunya

runners.comment: Tailed off back on Flat last time and drop to 7f unlikely to help
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in back-to-back efforts over timber and same story back on the level at the Curragh 11 days ago; drop to 7f unlikely to help.

runners.name: Harry The Rogue
runners.comment: 0-17; beaten at evens on Friday and he's risky for win purposes
runners.spotlight: 17-race maiden and a beaten even money favourite at Dundalk on Friday; will probably be in the mix again but he's risky for win purposes; drops back to 7f.

runners.name: Hastily
runners.comment: Winner on AW in December and back to form when 2nd on AW last month; 1lb higher up in trip
runners.spotlight: Got her head back in front at Dundalk in December and back to form when runner-up over 5f on AW last month; 1lb higher but return to further is fine and should give a good account back up in trip.

quotes.race: Silver Shine Turf Services Ltd Handicap
quotes.quote: I was lucky to pick up Hastily for 1,000gns, but she's a very big girl. It's a similar story with Coffeemeanscoffee, I suppose ? I picked her up for just 800gns. You need to be patient with these big-framed horses ? some of the bigger yards aren't - Tom McGuinness, trainer.

runners.name: Nikki Swango
runners.owner: Claire Wylie & Cathal Mcguckin & John C Mcconnell
runners.comment: 1-22; no wins since 2023 6f AW maiden but hinted at return to form latest
runners.spotlight: Sole win from 22 starts came in a 6f Dundalk maiden in 2023; hinted at a return to form over this trip at Dundalk 12 days ago and she's well treated if she can build on that.

runners.name: Are You In Or Out
runners.comment: 0-17; went close at the Curragh prior to lesser run on AW; off 154 days and headgear off
runners.spotlight: 17-race maiden who went close in a 7f Curragh handicap at the back end of last season but not as good on AW since; off 154 days and headgear off; may need this.

runners.name: Chica Power
runners.comment: Losing run since AW claimer success in 2023; didn't show enough on yard debut 112 days ago
runners.spotlight: Losing run since a Dundalk claimer success in 2023; didn't show enough on yard debut 112 days ago and modest record fresh.

quotes.race: Racing Again July 14th Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Chica Power travelled well, picked up when Billy wanted to and was straightforward enough - Pat Martin, trainer.

quotes.race: Find Us On Facebook @dundalkstadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Chica Power will go jumping over the summer and we'll try and get another one with her here. She has a bit of size and strength - Ciaran Murphy, trainer.

runners.name: Browned Off
runners.comment: Minor maiden promise; beaten 4l over 1m here on h'cap debut; may not appreciate 7f
runners.spotlight: Only minor promise in maidens and was beaten roughly 4l over 1m here on handicap debut; not sure to appreciate 7f.

runners.name: Bucky Larson
runners.comment: Veteran down a long way in the weights; no signs of a revival at Dundalk (7f) latest
