runners.spotlight: Veteran who has fallen a long way down the weights but no signs of a revival over this trip at Dundalk 12 days ago; headgear removed and best watched for now.

quotes.race: Dundalk Stadium Claiming Race
quotes.quote: Bucky Larson has been coming down the handicap all year and I felt the last day that he was something like himself. He was entitled to do that - Colin Keane, rider

quotes.race: Naas Racecourse Handicap
quotes.quote: Bucky Larson has a bit of class in races like that. He's a good lead horse at home and pulls one out of the bag every so often - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: "Paddy & Saoirse Casey" Handicap
quotes.quote: Bucky Larson is still a baby of a horse but we think he'll get ten furlongs in time. He's a lovely individual, he's growing up and I'd say there's another day or two in him - Ger Lyons, trainer

quotes.race: Leopardstown Summer Pass Maiden
quotes.quote: We rode him all wrong at Dundalk. We don't take back from the stalls and it was just the wrong way to ride him.His work at home had been good and he loves hunting one down. That's what we were expecting him to do at Dundalk and we were disappointed last time but I'd rather win here - Ger Lyons, trainer

runners.name: Deuteronomy
runners.comment: 24-race maiden and out of form on the all-weather this winter; best form over bit further
runners.spotlight: 24-race maiden and out of form on the all-weather this winter; best form over a bit further than this trip.

runners.name: Quiet Affair
runners.comment: 14-race maiden and has barely beaten a rival in her last five starts; off 112 days
runners.spotlight: 14-race maiden and has barely beaten a rival in her last five starts; off 112 days.

runners.name: Guest Star
runners.comment: Off the mark in recent Dundalk claimer; hasn't built on that twice since; 0-20 on turf
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark in a Dundalk claimer in January but hasn't built on that in two runs for new yard; shorter trip may help but turf record of 0-20 is off-putting.

runners.name: Si Senior
runners.comment: Sole win came in 2023 sprint but step back in right direction when beaten 1l here latest
runners.spotlight: Sole win came in sprint maiden at Sligo in 2023; major step back in right direction when fourth of 20 (beaten 1l) last week in new headgear combination (retained); extra furlong is fine and should be involved again with handy draw.

runners.name: Still Rolling
runners.comment: 2 promising 7f runs last term; well held when last seen and likely to need this
runners.spotlight: Two promising runs at 7f last season but well held over that trip when last seen and probably best watched stepping up in distance for new yard after 247 days off.

runners.name: Higher Kingdom
runners.comment: 6 wins on AW; step back in right direction when beaten 2l last week; extra 1f may help
runners.spotlight: All six wins have come on AW and it was a step back in the right direction when beaten roughly 2l at Gowran last week; shaped like this extra furlong will help and has to be high on any shortlist.

quotes.race: Floodlit Friday Nights At Dundalk Stadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Higher Kingdom is a talented horse. He travelled like a dream and he just did enough - John McConnell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has really progressed this winter as having won off 62 in December at Dundalk, he has since added two more wins at the track and is up to a rating of 86 now. The plan is to send him over to Lingfield on Good Friday for either the 1m or 1m2f race. Even though he's now at a career-high mark, I think there could be a little more to come. He's a very talented horse who was highly thought of as a juvenile, but like so many Kingmans he has a mind of his own and has taken a while to get back on track. He was disappointing last time out, but he seems grand at the moment and we'll almost certainly be claiming off him at Lingfield. I'm not entirely sure who'll get the ride but Siobhan Rutledge has won twice on him. 06-04-23

runners.name: Dynamite Defense
runners.comment: Beat Comfort Line over 1m in September; shaped okay twice since and may come on for latest
runners.spotlight: Got the better of an in-form Comfort Line (runs earlier on card) over 1m in September and has shaped okay both starts since; may come on for latest Dundalk outing and capable of having a say.

runners.name: Duleek Street
runners.comment: Hurdle winner who is 0-12 on the Flat but only seen once last season and off 337 days
runners.spotlight: Hurdle winner who is 0-12 on the Flat but only seen once last season and has been off 337 days.

runners.name: Serengeti Sunrise

prev_owners.owner: Elb Bloodstock Ltd And R L Banks
Ms E L Banks And R L Banks

runners.comment: Sole win came on AW (7f) in 2023 and struggled in six starts for his new connections
runners.spotlight: Sole win came on AW (7f) in 2023 and struggled in six starts for his new connections; hard to fancy at present.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him back as I think he can keep improving. I wasn't particularly overwhelmed with his first run but I think he's not taken the cold winter as well as some of the other horses in the yard. He's not quite come to himself and we'll see how he goes on the grass, but I could see him taking a big step forward as he just strengthens up. 29-03-24

runners.name: Sayfa Fad
runners.comment: Unplaced in 10 starts so far and tailed off on February's reappearance; blinkers on
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in 10 starts so far and tailed off on February's reappearance; wears first-time blinkers.

runners.name: Slieve Bearnagh
runners.comment: Won twice over timber last term; 2 good Flat runs over further last term; may need this
runners.spotlight: Won twice over timber last season and two good runs on the Flat over a bit further than this including a third of 11 at Bellewstown (1m4f, yielding) in October; mixed record fresh and suspicion he needs a bit further; new yard.

quotes.race: Mallow Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Slieve Bearnagh got into a lovely rhythm out in front and Josh made use of his jumping. The horse will mix it with the Flat - Michael Halford, co-trainer.

runners.name: Harbanaker
runners.comment: Course winner; missed 2024 but encouraging yard debut latest; may come on for that
runners.spotlight: Course winner; missed all of 2024 but encouraging yard debut when making up some late ground from rear at Dundalk 12 days ago; interesting runner back here if he comes on for that and one to consider.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Apprentice Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Harbanaker was a bit far back and hit a small bit of a flat spot but when I got a few back-handers into him he ran all the way to the line - Robert Whearty rider.

runners.name: Knockmore Prince
runners.comment: 0-25; slow start at Gowran last week when 4th of 11 over similar trip; needs more
runners.spotlight: 25-race maiden; slow start at Gowran last week when a distant fourth of 11 over a similar trip to this; more required.

11:40.going_detailed: TURF: GOOD changed to GOOD TO FIRM after Race 1 (11.40am)

runners.name: Cervin
runners.comment: Broke his maiden tag in November; held in higher grade last time but can bounce back here
runners.spotlight: Broke his maiden tag with a C&D win in November and remained competitive in two starts after; held in a higher grade last time but can bounce back now dropped again.

runners.name: Ninja Derby
runners.breeder: T E Luke, Kim & Peter McKay & Waika
runners.owner: Wilson Chan Wai Kwok, Joseph Yim Wai Ho & Gary Ng Ka Wai
runners.comment: Landed consecutive victories either side of the season break; form since has been mixed
runners.spotlight: Landed consecutive victories either side of the season break; form since has been mixed and a career best is needed to defy his current mark.

runners.name: Smashing Express
runners.comment: Has threatened multiple times this term; looks poised to make his breakthrough soon
runners.spotlight: Still winless after 12 starts but has threatened multiple times this term; looks poised to make his breakthrough soon.

runners.name: Windicator Family
runners.owner: Thomas Poon Ho Wing & Poon Chi Keung
runners.comment: Made his local breakthrough with a strong-finishing C&D success last month; 5lb higher now
runners.spotlight: Made his local breakthrough with a strong-finishing C&D success last month; 5lb higher now but could build on that.

runners.name: Strongest Boy
runners.owner: Ricky Wong Kin Chat & Helen Leung Yee Wan
runners.comment: Underwhelming even when eased in grade last time and a revival is needed
runners.spotlight: Gained a deserved C&D victory last season but hasn't repeated that form since; underwhelming even when eased in grade last time and a revival is needed.

runners.name: Wisdom Star
runners.comment: Has shown very little in eight career starts; can't be recommended
runners.spotlight: Has shown very little in eight career starts; can't be recommended.

runners.name: Tradition
runners.comment: Not disgraced in nine outings this season but has yet to pose a serious threat
runners.spotlight: Not disgraced in nine outings this season but has yet to pose a serious threat; continues to fall in the weights.

runners.name: Casa Legend
runners.breeder: B J Lindsay Mnzm & Mrs J E A Lindsay
runners.comment: Bagged his second career win in September but form has been patchy since
runners.spotlight: Bagged his second career win over 1m at Sha Tin in September but form has been patchy since; remains just 1lb above that winning mark.

runners.name: Mr Aladdin
runners.comment: Hinted at progress when fourth over 1m3f here last time; needs to build on that now
runners.spotlight: Maiden after 19 starts but hinted at progress when finishing fourth over 1m3f here last time; needs to build on that now.

runners.name: Verbier
runners.comment: Still searching for a breakthrough but has gone close this term; one of the likelier ones
runners.spotlight: Still searching for a breakthrough but has gone close this season, notably over C&D last month; one of the likelier ones today.

runners.name: Superb Move
runners.owner: Mo Chan Ming, Howard Tai Wai Yin & Edmund Lo Chai Wan
runners.comment: Ran well in a tight finish here in February; respected on that effort and not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Scored on last season's return and ran well in a tight finish here in February; respected on that form and not ruled out.

runners.name: Winning Seven
runners.comment: 16-race maiden whose recent efforts have been lacklustre; needs to offer more
runners.spotlight: 16-race maiden whose recent efforts have been lacklustre; well handicapped on past form but needs to offer more.

runners.name: Apolar Fighter
runners.comment: Looked to be progressing when fourth over C&D in January but has disappointed twice since
runners.spotlight: Looked to be progressing when fourth over C&D in January but has disappointed twice since; needs to get back on track.

runners.name: Tsuen Wan Glory
runners.breeder: L De Souza, T Hartley Et Al
runners.comment: Yet to show much this term but has dropped to a workable mark and can't be dismissed
runners.spotlight: Dual 7f winner at Sha Tin last season; yet to show much this term but has dropped to a workable mark and can't be dismissed.

12:10.going_detailed: TURF: GOOD changed to GOOD TO FIRM after Race 1 (11.40am)

runners.name: Giddy Up
runners.comment: Held since making his breakthrough but may fare better now eased in grade
runners.spotlight: Broke his maiden tag over 7f at Sha Tin last season; held in three starts this term but may fare better now eased in grade.

runners.name: Northern Fire Ball
runners.comment: Landed a C&D win in December but has been held off his revised mark since; more needed
runners.spotlight: Landed a C&D win in December but has been held off his revised mark in three outings since; needs to take a step forward.

runners.name: Master Of Humor
runners.comment: AUD$80,000 yearling; has shown little in recent barrier trials; opposed on debut.
runners.spotlight: AUD$80,000 yearling; has shown little in recent barrier trials; opposed on debut.

runners.name: Loveisintheair
runners.comment: Posted a couple of respectable efforts over C&D last month; no surprise if he plays a role
runners.spotlight: Posted a couple of respectable efforts over C&D last month; would be no surprise if he was to play a big role today.

runners.name: Spicy Spangle
runners.comment: Added to his Sha Tin success here last month; 6lb higher but remains one to take seriously
runners.spotlight: Added to his November Sha Tin win with a 5f success here last month; now 6lb higher but remains one to take seriously.

runners.name: Chill Master
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Francis Lee Bing Kwong & Yves Lee Kun Fun
runners.comment: Little to show from three starts so far; not recommended until showing more
runners.spotlight: Little to show from three starts so far; not recommended until showing more.

runners.name: Oriental Surprise
runners.comment: Creditable fifth in December but two disappointing efforts followed; needs to bounce back
runners.spotlight: Improved on a low-key debut when a creditable fifth in December but two disappointing efforts have followed; needs to bounce back.

runners.name: Glory Cloud
runners.comment: Winless in 13 career starts; form has dipped recently and a revival is needed
runners.spotlight: Winless in 13 career starts but has seriously threatened on a couple of occasions; form has dipped recently and a revival is needed.

runners.name: Cosmo Navigator
runners.comment: Broke his maiden tag with a 5f victory at Sha Tin in December; held off his new mark since
runners.spotlight: Broke his maiden tag with a 5f victory at Sha Tin in December; held off his new mark since and now needs more.

runners.name: Team Happy
runners.comment: Recent efforts have been poor; 4lb below his last winning mark so should be showing more
runners.spotlight: In good form earlier this term but recent efforts have been poor; 4lb below his last winning mark so should be showing more.

runners.name: Triumphant Warrior
runners.breeder: Newlands House Stud & Mrs A M Burns
runners.owner: Bernard Man, Stephen Man Shiu Fai & Gerard Man
runners.comment: 17-race maiden who has gone close on multiple occasions; belated first win looks possible
runners.spotlight: 17-race maiden who has gone close on multiple occasions this season; surely only a matter of time before he gets his head in front.

runners.name: Same To You
runners.owner: Colin Cheung Kwok Lam, Amos Cheung Sai Keung & Gary H K Yau
runners.comment: Scored on his return and added a C&D win in February; up 6lb and facing tougher rivals
runners.spotlight: Scored on his seasonal return and added a C&D win in February; up 6lb and facing tougher rivals but remains in good heart.

runners.name: Solar River
runners.comment: Took a step forward in January but has struggled since; has ability if putting it together
runners.spotlight: Took a step forward when second in January but has struggled to build on that effort; has ability if putting it all together.

runners.name: Glory B
runners.owner: Dr Bankee Kwan Pak Hoo & Jeffrey Kwan Teng Hin
runners.comment: Ran well off his new mark last time; strong claims in current mood if making the line-up
runners.spotlight: Gained a deserved C&D win in February and ran well off his new mark last time; strong claims in current mood if making the line-up.

12:40.going_detailed: TURF: GOOD changed to GOOD TO FIRM after Race 1 (11.40am)

runners.name: Floof
runners.comment: Turf winner in Australia and won on the Sha Tin dirt; out of form since; poor record here
runners.spotlight: Two years have passed after he ended his days in Australia with a win (7f) and nearly seven months since he scored on the Sha Tin dirt track (1m); well held in three subsequent appearances and heavily beaten on both previous starts at this venue; has plenty to prove, especially from stall 12.

runners.name: Harmony Galaxy
runners.comment: Knocking on the door of a first win and stepping up to this trip could prove the catalyst
runners.spotlight: Career record is 0-19 but three times he has been beaten a half-length or less on this course (1m), including last time out; the way he runs suggests this first go at 1m1f should be to his liking; serious contender.

runners.name: Cant Go Wong
runners.breeder: J S Alexander, W Bevins Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Ciaron Maher Racing, M Tsang Et Al

runners.comment: C&D winner and nicely weighted on best form; last three runs leave questions to answer
runners.spotlight: One win and a second from just four appearances over track and trip and has finished in the money six times in eight starts under Matthew Poon; even so, he figures on a very fair mark in the handicap; the concern is that his last three outings have seen him well held at the finish and it's a case of whether you can ignore those performances.

runners.name: Toy Soltero
runners.comment: Possesses some ability but little consistency and well beaten on his last two outings
runners.spotlight: Unbeaten in four starts in Chile (three at Group 2 level); he is 0-12 since moving to Hong Kong and while there have been two or three efforts which suggest he has a future, consistency has not been there and he arrives on the back of a pair of poor results.

runners.name: Charming Steed
runners.comment: Best on Sha Tin dirt; two course wins but vulnerable to the younger brigade at the weights
runners.spotlight: Although he is truly in his element when tackling the Sha Tin dirt track, has won twice around this circuit and was a winner on his only previous attempt at 1m1f; expect to seem him pressing the pace but he does not appeal strongly for win purposes at these weights against some younger rivals with pretensions to improve.

runners.name: S J Tourbillon
runners.owner: Ma Ren De & Dr Ma Yuen Yuen

prev_owners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier

runners.comment: C&D win before a year out with injury; not shown enough in five runs back to support him
runners.spotlight: Can lay claim to a C&D success but that was nearly two years ago; there has been only a flicker of potential in the five runs since returning from a year off and we need to see a little more before evaluating how much ability he has retained.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: he's been nurtured along so, I suppose, Group/Classic material is where they really want to end up. I'd be happy enough to say a mile is comfortable enough for him, maybe even back a furlong starting next year - Seamie Heffernan, jockey

runners.name: Firefoot
runners.comment: Course winner who should enjoy first tilt at 1m1f; plenty of promise last time; player
runners.spotlight: Showed a good attitude before asserting late on to break his duck here in January (1m); he has finished out of the first three in four starts since but there was plenty to like about a recent fourth behind Mighty Strength at Sha Tin (1m2f); should be suited by first attempt at this trip and is certainly one for the shortlist.

runners.name: Brave Witness
runners.comment: Won here (1m) in July; poor start to this campaign but did better last time; claims
runners.spotlight: Picked up an opening win here in July (1m), but has failed to make much of an impact in five subsequent appearances; he's now down to a mark 1lb above his winning rung in the handicap; very poor first four starts this term, but there was a little more encouragement last time, suggesting he may be finding his form; interesting.

runners.name: Yodas Choice
runners.owner: Alan Lee Yu Sing & Estate Of The Late Lee Kwok Kay
runners.comment: Off the mark last time (1m1f) on the Sha Tin dirt; 0-7 round here and that's a concern
runners.spotlight: Came good last time on his 19th start, having accrued five runner-up finishes along the way; however, that success came on the dirt at Sha Tin (1m1f) and he has managed just one fourth place from seven forays over this turf track; can't be dismissed but needs to show he can strut his stuff at this venue.

runners.name: The Way We Win
runners.comment: Big defeats in compiling 0-7 record in Hong Kong and market has not expected anything else
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in all seven starts since his arrival in Hong Kong; has racked up wide-margin defeats at very big odds and there is no logical reason to believe that is about to change as he attempts a new distance.

runners.name: Me Time
runners.comment: C&D winner in November; has run well in defeat since and could go close off this mark
runners.spotlight: Well backed and displayed a willing outlook to open his account over C&D in November; he has not run a bad race since and with a slight relenting from the handicapper he is on a mark just 4lb above his winning one; every chance of being involved where it counts.

runners.name: Youth Power
runners.comment: Course winner and not disgraced since; has dropped to a very fair mark with strong claims
runners.spotlight: Landed a first win at this venue (1m) in December and has turned in five solid enough performances since then; dropped another 2lb for this, he can be given a good chance off a mark just 1lb higher than he last won from; did not quite last home over 1m2f last time and this trip may suit better; contender.

runners.name: All Are Mine
runners.comment: Won on the Sha Tin dirt 16 months ago but has shown little since returning from a year out
runners.spotlight: Scored on the Sha Tin dirt course in December 2023 but has not created much of a stir since coming back from a year-long injury break; hard to make a case for him on recent evidence.

runners.name: Pegasus General
runners.comment: Twice a winner here (including over C&D) but has found life tough in this class
runners.spotlight: Twice a winner here, including over this trip; has found a revised handicap mark something of an anchor after recording a nose victory here in January; others more compelling.

1:10.going_detailed: TURF: GOOD changed to GOOD TO FIRM after Race 1 (11.40am)

runners.name: Yee Cheong Spirit
runners.comment: C&D winner who needs to step up greatly on a poor run last time if he is to be competitive
runners.spotlight: Came with a strong run from off the pace over this track and trip to deliver a first victory in November; he's produced a mixed bag of performances since that success and while there is some evidence to suggest he can be competitive under top weight, a dismal effort last time makes that outcome less likely.

runners.name: Gameplayer Elite
runners.owner: Lam Yau Pik, Rex Lam Lam & Monica Lam Mung Ni
runners.comment: C&D winner who returned to form with a close second last time; major chance on that run
runners.spotlight: Unbeaten in three outings in his native Brazil; scored over track and trip last term but made a slow and uninspiring start to this season; left behind those dull efforts when failing by a neck to overhaul Great Sprint over this 6f last month; he's gone up 1lb for that and remains a serious contender.

runners.name: Sovereign Fund
runners.breeder: S F Bloodstock L L C
runners.owner: Glenn Chan Wai Cheung & Raymond Chan Ka Shun

prev_owners.owner: Newgate Bloodstock, China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.comment: Unplaced in all 11 Hong Kong runs but his close fourth last time puts him in with a chance
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in all 11 starts in Hong Kong but has recorded two fourths, both of which put his chance in a good light; the most recent came on his latest run when a close fourth behind Ace Power; if he can build on that effort there is a position in the first three beckoning.

runners.name: King Victor
runners.comment: Bred for sprinting and has shown some ability in trials; likely to need a little more time
runners.spotlight: First foal of a winning mare (6.75f) and bred on both sides of his pedigree to be a sprinter; two recent barrier trials have shown him to have a measure of ability without suggesting he is a natural to score first time out.

runners.name: Harmony N Home
runners.owner: Cheung Ming Man, Cheung Ying Ho Et Al
runners.comment: Triple C&D winner who defied his age to win last month; much more to do after a 7lb rise
runners.spotlight: May be in the veteran stage but he packed a powerful finish to land a third C&D win when last seen a month ago; he has been raised 7lb for that half-length triumph and, in what looks a slightly better contest, makes less appeal than some others.

runners.name: Victorythirtythree
runners.comment: All-the-way 5f winner here in October but wide draw and extra furlong temper his chances
runners.spotlight: Speedy sort who started from gate 7 when making all the running to gain a first Hong Kong success (5f) in mid-October; stall 12 makes things harder and defeated three times since but not beaten too far; a better horse than when beaten on both 6f starts, but has to prove himself over this trip.

runners.name: Exceed The Wish
runners.comment: Much-improved run last time; lightly raced and has scope to progress again and be a player
runners.spotlight: Has gone off at big odds in all four career starts; on the first three occasions he ran as the betting indicated but last month he caught the eye despite finishing only sixth; he met trouble while making ground from the rear but finished just two lengths off the winner, Great Spirit; has to enter calculations if that was a corner turned.

runners.name: Super Sicario
runners.owner: Tony Lau Yiu Tong & Thomas Lau Sum Fai
runners.comment: Well held at huge odds on all three starts and needs to find some major improvement
runners.spotlight: The penny has yet to drop with this one; triple-digit odds on all three starts and yet to make any impact; difficult to make a case for him this time.

runners.name: Excellent Peers
runners.owner: Chan Tung, Kwan Wah Et Al
runners.comment: Not the force of old but running respectably for most of the season; others appeal more
runners.spotlight: All four of his wins have come when tackling this 6f but he has recorded 25 defeats in a row; while that means he is also 25lb below his last winning mark, and he has not been disgraced this season, it would be disappointing if several of these are not too sharp for him at the finish.

runners.name: Good Prospect
runners.comment: Has shown enough ability in eight runs without a win to think he can be placed at least
runners.spotlight: In the frame four times in his eight appearances; a pair of February second-place finishes (beaten less than a length each time) were followed by a fair fourth when he did not enjoy the best of luck in the home straight; place hopes at least.

runners.name: Young Horizon
runners.comment: His 3 wins have come over 7f at Sha Tin; good runs here have been far fewer than the poor
runners.spotlight: A winner this term, he has one decent effort in his last six but needs to break new ground on several fronts if is to oblige; all three wins have come at Sha Tin; all three came over 7f; he has been placed only four times from 14 ventures at this track.

runners.name: Circuit Fiery
runners.breeder: Haunui Bloodstock Ltd & B J O'Brien
runners.owner: Jason Cheung Cho Yee & Cheung Ka Shing
runners.comment: Has ability despite no wins; return to this shorter trip may see him ruffle a few feathers
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden who finished unplaced on his sole start at this course (1m) when trying to lead throughout; gave encouragement in both previous attempts at this distance (particularly behind Sugar Ball in November) and could be a surprise package.

runners.name: Robot Knight
runners.comment: Far better on dirt than turf and switches to this venue for the first time; passed over
runners.spotlight: Picked up the one victory on his CV tackling this distance, but it was achieved on the dirt surface at Sha Tin; his four forays on turf (all at Sha Tin) have ended in disappointment; makes his Happy Valley debut with plenty to prove.

runners.name: King Show
runners.comment: Showed a little more last time but looks like one for further down the line
runners.spotlight: Revealed a modicum of ability last time but not enough to add him to the shortlist on this occasion; he has raced only three times and is entitled to find improvement in time.

1:40.race_name: Hong Kong China Rugby Cup (Handicap) (Class 3) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)
1:40.going_detailed: TURF: GOOD changed to GOOD TO FIRM after Race 1 (11.40am)

runners.name: Harmony N Blessed
runners.owner: Cheung Ming Man, Cheung Ying Ho Et Al
runners.comment: Below form on both 6f starts last month but was placed off 5lb higher over C&D in February
runners.spotlight: Has very mixed record this season and needs to up his game after two below-par 6f runs last month but was placed off 5lb higher over C&D in February and is well drawn today; can't be ruled out.

runners.name: Youthful Spirits

prev_owners.owner: Apache Cat Pty Ltd, Ms D L Eurell Et Al

runners.comment: Lost out only by a nose after brave attempt to make all over C&D last month
runners.spotlight: Yet to win this season but has been very consistent since November, and lost out only by a nose to Colourful King after brave attempt to make all over C&D last month; has to take a 2lb rise on the chin but ought to give this another good shot.

runners.name: Eternal Fortune
runners.comment: In good form over 5f/6f this season and probably won't be far away
runners.spotlight: Still 7lb higher than for narrow 6f course win in January but kept on well for fourth over C&D on latest outing six weeks ago; probably won't be far away.

runners.name: Colourful King
runners.comment: Built upon promising Hong Kong debut when narrow C&D winner last month; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 3yo who built upon his promising Hong Kong debut when finishing well to pip Youthful Spirits over C&D last month; could easily have more to offer; shortlisted.

runners.name: Casa Of Honor
runners.comment: 5-8 in Australia; not seen since October; has outside draw on Hong Kong debut
runners.spotlight: 5-8 when trained in Australia; not seen since winning 5f handicap in October, though, and has the outside draw on this Hong Kong debut.

runners.name: Seasons Wit
runners.owner: Ronald Lo Yeung Chun & Teddy Lo Yeung Man

prev_owners.owner: James Harron Bloodstock Colts, Mrs B C Bateman Et Al

runners.comment: In the frame over 6f here two runs ago but generally very disappointing this season
runners.spotlight: Kept on for fourth over 6f here two starts ago but has generally been very disappointing this season and today's drop back to 5f is not an obvious positive.

runners.name: Basic Instinct
runners.owner: 22/23 Me Tsui Yu Sak Trainer Syndicate
runners.comment: Always towards rear when a big-priced outsider for recent Hong Kong debut (6f)
runners.spotlight: 1-4 in New Zealand, the win gained over 6f last August; always towards rear when a big-priced outsider for recent Hong Kong debut (6f); drops back in trip today.

runners.name: Watch This One
runners.comment: Won on debut in Australia; fourth over C&D on recent Hong Kong debut; interesting
runners.spotlight: Won on debut in Australia last August and made promising start to Hong Kong career last month, keeping on for fourth behind Colourful King and Youthful Spirits over C&D; can feature if that outing brought him on.

runners.name: King Eccellente
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Patrick Fung Pak Tung & Ophelia Fung Wing Sei

prev_owners.owner: Mr & Mrs Patrick Fung Pak Tung & Ophelia Fung Wing Sei

runners.comment: Class 4 C&D winner in December but has found things tough since upped in grade
runners.spotlight: Stayed on strongly for narrow Class 4 C&D win in December but has found things tough in this higher grade this year.

runners.name: Multidutch
runners.comment: Won in Australia last year but was a down-the-field outsider on his first two HK starts
runners.spotlight: Won in Australia last year but was a down-the-field outsider on his first two Hong Kong starts (5f/6f); favourable draw not enough to make him of interest today,

2:10.going_detailed: TURF: GOOD changed to GOOD TO FIRM after Race 1 (11.40am)

runners.name: Stellar Swift
runners.owner: Lily Chan Li Lei & Marc Chan

prev_owners.owner: Lindsay Park Bloodstock, J S C Chua Et Al

runners.comment: Sound effort when fourth over 7f last month; can cope with this drop back in trip
runners.spotlight: Won over 7f at Sha Tin in early part of season and appreciated dip back into this grade when fourth over that C&D last month; can cope with today's drop back in trip but may not have enough early zip to make full use of his favourable draw.

runners.name: Turf Phoenix
runners.owner: Dr John Shum Ding Ping & Dr Lawrence Chan Pui Wing
runners.comment: Very useful 2yo in Britain but yet to make a splash in Hong Kong; drops in grade today
runners.spotlight: Very useful 2yo when trained in Britain but, following a long absence, has struggled to get competitive in Hong Kong this season (six runs); drops in grade today.

runners.name: Bowser
runners.comment: Twice made the frame over C&D last month and has the plum inside draw today
runners.spotlight: Largely consistent 4yo who made the frame over C&D twice last month; remains on a workable mark and ought to make his presence felt from stall 1.

runners.name: Galvanic
runners.comment: Stayed on well for third on last three appearances, most recently over C&D two months ago
runners.spotlight: Stayed on well for third on last three appearances, most recently from stall 12 over C&D two months ago; has another wide draw today but no surprise if he makes good late headway again.

runners.name: Beauty Thunder
runners.comment: Yet to be placed after seven Hong Kong starts; others look much more likely
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all seven Hong Kong starts; ran quite well when fifth over C&D in February but last month's run here was a backward step; others have much more persuasive profiles.

runners.name: Club Ace
runners.comment: Slightly disappointing last time but began career with four encouraging runs beforehand
runners.spotlight: Slightly disappointing when favourite for latest race four weeks ago but launched career with four very encouraging runs (5f-6f) and remains one to be interested in.

runners.name: Rich Horse
runners.comment: Has struggled to get seriously competitive on his first six Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: Won on debut in Ireland in 2023 but has struggled to get seriously competitive on his first six Hong Kong starts (5f-7f).

runners.name: Super Goldi
runners.breeder: B J Lindsay Mnzm & Mrs J E A Lindsay
runners.comment: Regressive 5yo who needs to turn a corner
runners.spotlight: Regressive 5yo who is yet to be placed after five runs this season (6f-1m); needs to turn a corner.

runners.name: Ace Power
runners.owner: Chan Ngan Chi & Chen Yung Hung
runners.comment: Ran on strongly for last-gasp C&D win last month; still well handicapped on older form
runners.spotlight: Exploited some considerable help from the handicapper last month, running on strongly for a last-gasp C&D win; it's hard to tell whether he'll build on that performance but he remains very well treated on older form.

runners.name: Brave Joy
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Matthew Lam Kin Hong
runners.comment: Yet to show anything more than minor promise after four runs and has a tough draw today
runners.spotlight: Yet to show anything more than minor promise after four runs and has a tough draw today.

runners.name: Super Charizzard
runners.comment: Holding his own at this higher level lately but has been dealt a duff hand draw-wise today
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner in Class 5 this season; holding his own at this higher level lately but has been dealt a duff hand draw-wise today.

runners.name: Telecom Power
runners.owner: Cheung King Shek, Billy Cheung King Shan Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Pulse Dream Genie, P M O'Shea Et Al

runners.comment: 0-15 in Hong Kong but went close over C&D two starts ago and enters calculations
runners.spotlight: 0-15 in Hong Kong but lost out only by a neck over C&D last month and didn't really have the race run to suit when only sixth here a fortnight later; enters calculations.

runners.name: Casa Rubick
runners.breeder: B J Lindsay Mnzm & Mrs J E A Lindsay
runners.comment: Makes official debut after some underwhelming recent trials; can only be watched
runners.spotlight: Out of a 7f/1m winner; makes official debut after some underwhelming recent trials; can only be watched.

runners.name: Yiu Cheung Victory
runners.comment: Six-time winner in Macau but a down-the-field outsider on all four Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: Six-time winner in Macau but a down-the-field outsider on all four Hong Kong starts.

2:45.going_detailed: TURF: GOOD changed to GOOD TO FIRM after Race 1 (11.40am)

runners.name: Quantum Patch

prev_owners.owner: David Spratt & Sean Jones & Mrs Lynne Lyons

runners.comment: Consistent in Class 3 this year; must be considered in this lower grade
runners.spotlight: Without a win since November 2023 but pretty consistent in Class 3 this year (1m-1m1f) and benefits from combination of drop in grade and favourable draw today; must be considered.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Bingo Bronson is a nice horse. He's very much a baby, he loved that ground, and I would say you won't see the best of him till next year - Ger Lyons, trainer.

runners.name: Turin Warrior
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner this season; ran poorly last time, though, and remains on tough mark
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner this season but ran very poorly when dropped back to 7f at Sha Tin recently and remains on a tough mark.

runners.name: Casa Rochester
runners.comment: 0-5 in Hong Kong but both C&D runs last month were very respectable
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all five Hong Kong starts but both C&D runs last month were very respectable and a recent 2lb drop helps; Hugh Bowman takes the ride today; could have a say.

runners.name: Sky Vino
runners.comment: Low-mileage 3yo; has gone close at Sha Tin since last month's C&D win; respected
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 3yo who came good with a narrow win C&D win last month and was close second from a wide stall at Sha Tin 18 days later; drawn wide again today but may still be on the upgrade; respected.

runners.name: Gallant Epoch
runners.owner: Dr & Mrs Simon Suen Siu Man & Chloe Suen
runners.comment: In-form front-runner; won over 7f two starts ago; moves up in trip today
runners.spotlight: Made all for clearcut 7f win at Sha Tin in February, his fourth run, and held on gamely until thwarted by strong finisher over that C&D last month; upped in trip today; likely to make another bold bid from the front.

runners.name: The Azure
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Alan Ho Pui Lun & Mr & Mrs Norman Tang Fai Ng
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner this season; not quite at best lately; still on tough mark
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner this season; not quite at best on last couple of outings, though, and will need to kick on again to overcome current mark.

runners.name: Red Majesty
runners.breeder: S A G Coombe & Haunui Farm Lp
runners.owner: Pong Kin Yee, Samson Yip Yan Tion Et Al
runners.comment: On a good mark but has modest strike-rate in recent years; younger rivals preferred
runners.spotlight: Didn't run badly when sixth over C&D a week ago and remains well handicapped but has very modest strike-rate in recent years; younger rivals appeal more.

runners.name: Ocean Impact
runners.comment: Improved form when close second over C&D last month, his third start; may progress again
runners.spotlight: Began career with two low-key 7f runs but displayed improvement when close second over C&D three weeks ago and has plenty of scope for further progress over this trip.

runners.name: Jumbo Fortune
runners.comment: No longer the force of old but has been placed over C&D on last three outings
runners.spotlight: No longer the force of old but is handicapped accordingly and has been placed over C&D on last three outings; probably won't be far away.

runners.name: To Infinity
runners.owner: Chan Wing Chiu & Yildiz Choi Yat Fan
runners.comment: In poor form this year and has the outside draw today
runners.spotlight: Now only 1lb higher than when pipping Red Majesty to score over C&D on Boxing Day but has been in poor form since turn of the year and is drawn on the outside today.

runners.name: Kingly Demeanor
runners.comment: Went close in this grade in February but, on balance, others look stronger
runners.spotlight: Won twice in Class 5 November (1m1f/1m3f) and went very close over 7f in this grade in February but his last two runs were below par and, on balance, others in this line-up look stronger.

runners.name: Flying Silver
runners.comment: Too well handicapped to rule out but has not been firing on all cylinders this year
runners.spotlight: Too well handicapped to rule out but has not been firing on all cylinders this year and has quite a bit more to prove than some.

runners.name: Night Purosangue
runners.comment: Yet to show anything more than minor promise after four sprint runs; headgear added
runners.spotlight: Yet to show anything more than minor promise after four sprint runs; needs combination of new trip and first-time cheekpieces to enable significant improvement.

runners.name: Positive Smile
runners.comment: Dual winner when based in Australia but yet to be placed after eight Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: Dual winner when based in Australia (5.9f/7f) but yet to be placed after eight Hong Kong starts (5f-6f); tries a new trip today; not the most obvious answer.

3:15.going_detailed: TURF: GOOD changed to GOOD TO FIRM after Race 1 (11.40am)

runners.name: Outgate
runners.comment: Penultimate run hinted at possible return to form; safely held since, though
runners.spotlight: Hinted at possible return to form when keeping-on fourth over 7f at Sha Tin last month but was safely held over that C&D three weeks later and now has it all to prove again.

quotes.race: Extra Places Every Day At Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: Outgate is a very progressive horse with a wicked turn of foot. He really filled out over the winter and keeps progressing with each run. He's developed into a proper racehorse and it would be nice to go for black type now - Claire Kubler, joint trainer.

quotes.race: Deepbridge Handicap
quotes.quote: Everything went right, Ryan [Moore] gave Outgate a beautiful ride and was very complimentary about the horse, saying he was very straightforward to ride. He's a nice horse and there's a very valuable race back here just before Royal Ascot and it might make sense to come back here for that - Daniel Kubler, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Star Contact
runners.comment: C&D winner at start of season but seems to have gone off the boil lately
runners.spotlight: Began season with C&D win in September and remained in form for a good while afterwards but seems to have gone off the boil lately.

runners.name: Cambridge

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier/Michael Tabor/Derrick Smith/Peter M Brant

runners.comment: Very useful when trained in Ireland but first three Hong Kong runs have been underwhelming
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 4yo; signed off for Aidan O'Brien with creditable second in 1m2f Royal Ascot handicap last June but all three Hong Kong runs this year (1m1f-1m2f) have been underwhelming and today's drop back in trip is probably not ideal.

quotes.race: Byerley Stud Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: We're pleased with that. It's been 18 years since we had a runner here and we were second that day with a subsequent Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe winner [Dylan Thomas] We thought Cambridge had improved since his run at Roscommon. He ran very green but was more professional there, the winning margin wasn't much but it's all about winning and I'm glad we have - Kevin Buckley, owners' representative.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Salisbury last season and ran well when second in the Eyrefield on his last start. He seems in good form and will probably step into a Derby trial next. 03-04-24

runners.name: Rocket Spade
runners.comment: Dual course winner this season (1m/1m1f); a possible if he gets a good pace to chase
runners.spotlight: Dual course winner from off the pace this season (1m/1m1f); got going a bit too late on last two appearances but has possibilities if he gets a good pace to aim at today.

runners.name: Kolachi
runners.comment: Struggled (albeit on dirt) on Hong Kong debut in February
runners.spotlight: Ended three-race 2yo campaign in Ireland with comfortable success in big-field maiden (1m, heavy) but, following a long absence, struggled (albeit on dirt) on Hong Kong debut in February.

runners.name: Charity Together
runners.comment: Signed off in Britain with three wins last August/September; makes Hong Kong debut today
runners.spotlight: Progressive handicapper in Britain last year, signing off with three consecutive wins (7f/1m) in August/September; sports first-time blinkers on Hong Kong debut; interesting to see how he fares.

quotes.race: Welcome To Family Day Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: When Corriamo is three and he's had a winter over him, he'll be a very strong horse, and I'd expect to see him in some better races. We hope it's onwards and upwards with him. He didn't handle coming down the hill for whatever reason, he was a bit slowly away and he couldn't quite go that early pace. He was a bit green, but we're very pleased - Marcus Tregoning, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Super Unicorn
runners.breeder: B J Lindsay Mnzm & Mrs J E A Lindsay
runners.comment: C&D winner in October but below form last month and remains on a tough mark
runners.spotlight: Placed another three times over C&D since his win here in October but was below form here last month and probably needs to bounce back with a career-best performance.

runners.name: Ivy League

prev_owners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith

runners.comment: Didn't fire here a week ago but has largely been in good form over C&D this season
runners.spotlight: Didn't fire here a week ago but has largely been in good form over C&D this season and is back on a workable mark now; contender if quickly back on song.

quotes.race: Naas Racecourse Business Club Blackwater Handicap
quotes.quote: Ivy League did that nicely. He's a big strong colt and he's very babyish still, he will progress and is probably not too bad. I don't think he'll have any problem stepping into stakes company. He is not short of pace. He would love horses in front of him and a race like the Jersey Stakes could be a good option for him - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Setanta
runners.owner: James Lau Po Man & Alice Woo Wai See

prev_owners.owner: Aquis Farm, C J Barham Et Al

runners.comment: Enjoyed mini revival towards end of last year but has lost his form again lately
runners.spotlight: Enjoyed a mini revival towards the end of last year, making the frame three times over C&D, but has lost his form again lately.

runners.name: Flying Fortress
runners.owner: 23/24 Cody Mo Wai Kit Trainer Syndicate
runners.comment: Much improved since upped to 1m for last two runs and has much better draw today
runners.spotlight: Launched Hong Kong career with three underwhelming 6f runs but was very close second over C&D when upped in trip in February and has since made the frame in this higher grade; much better drawn today; big player.

runners.name: Good Luck Win
runners.owner: Siu Wai Chung & Lo Nga Yin
runners.comment: Moves up in grade today but was a very stylish C&D winner last month
runners.spotlight: 2-6 for new stable since November; moves up in grade today but was a very stylish C&D winnner four weeks ago and needs to be taken very seriously in his current mood.

3:50.going_detailed: TURF: GOOD changed to GOOD TO FIRM after Race 1 (11.40am)

runners.name: Sugar Sugar
runners.comment: In career-best form last month but remains on a tough mark and has a wide draw today
runners.spotlight: Probably posted his two career-best performances over C&D last month, namely a close third and a very creditable fourth from stall 12; remains on a tough mark, though, and has another wide draw today.

runners.name: Absolute Honour

prev_owners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

runners.comment: Promising 2yo when based in Ireland but made underwhelming Hong Kong debut last month
runners.spotlight: A very promising 2yo in Ireland last year but made underwhelming Hong Kong debut when only ninth over C&D last month and needs to have taken significant benefit from that outing.

quotes.race: Tipperary Races Median Auction Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Surpass is a work in progress, he's still very babyish and when he puts it all together he has the makings of a lovely horse. He could go for a race like the Tyros Stakes now - Chris Armstrong, stable representative.

runners.name: Prestige Always
runners.comment: Given short break after two below-par runs in January; drawn wide; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Opened Hong Kong account with 7f win at Sha Tin in September but seemed to go off the boil after the turn of the year; drops back in trip on this first start for 80 days; drawn wide; others have more pressing claims.

quotes.race: Claregalwayhotel.ie Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: It was a very good run at the Curragh from Mythology the last day and he had a good run there the time before that as well. He deserved to get his head in front and he will get confidence from that. We think he is a horse who can hold his own in Group company as the season goes on. He'll probably go to Deauville in two weeks for a Group race. He handles a bit of juice but I think he would be fine on better ground too - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Super Joy N Fun
runners.owner: Johnny Wong Chun Nam, Nancy Wong Et Al
runners.comment: Ran well in defeat over C&D and remains on a workable mark; major player
runners.spotlight: Suited by the drop back in trip when running well in defeat over C&D three weeks ago; not so well drawn today but remains on a workable mark and features prominently in calculations.

runners.name: Golden Empire
runners.comment: In the frame both starts since C&D win in January; drawn much better than last time
runners.spotlight: In the frame both starts since narrow C&D win in January, more recently when fourth from stall 10 five weeks ago; has same mark and much better drawn today; likely contender again.

runners.name: Rising From Ashes
runners.comment: Regressive 7yo; placed over 7f in January but form has dipped again since
runners.spotlight: Regressive 7yo; suggested he might be ready to capitalise upon some help from the handicapper when close second over 7f in January but his form has dipped again since.

runners.name: Storm Rider
runners.comment: Kept on well from the rear on last two outings; each-way claims if race is run to suit
runners.spotlight: Not always one to rely upon heavily but kept on well from the rear on his last two appearances (7f/6f) and continues to edge down the weights; holds each-way claims if this race is run to suit him.

runners.name: Golden Rise
runners.owner: James Kwan Wai Ming & Leung Kam Chuen
runners.comment: In-form 5yo who ought to be right in the thick of things again
runners.spotlight: In-form 5yo who has been placed again since last month's narrow C&D win; nudged up to another career-high mark today but ought to be right in the thick of things.

runners.name: Charming Babe
runners.comment: Came good in Hong Kong with 25-1 C&D win in February; back up in grade today
runners.spotlight: Not an instant success in Hong Kong but was evidently well suited by the drop back in trip when causing 25-1 surprise from stall 11 over C&D six weeks ago; back up in grade today but might have more improvement to come.

runners.name: Conspirator
runners.owner: Ng Sun Wah, Au Yau Lin & Alan Leung Wai Zen
runners.comment: Flopped badly on Hong Kong debut but ought to be capable of better
runners.spotlight: 6.5f maiden winner on second of two starts in Australia; dropped out tamely and was unable to justify prominence in the betting when last of 12 on Hong Kong debut at Sha Tin in January but ought to be capable of better; sports first-time hood and has the plum inside draw here.

runners.name: Run Run Smart
runners.comment: Ran okay over C&D last month but has very mixed record this season and is drawn wide today
runners.spotlight: Kept on for respectable sixth over C&D four weeks ago but has a very mixed record this season and faces a tough task from stall 12 today.

runners.name: Young Arrow
runners.breeder: G S A Bloodstock Pty Ltd
runners.comment: 0-10 in HK but has made the frame over C&D on three of last four starts
runners.spotlight: 0-10 in Hong Kong and eligible for a drop in grade now but has made the frame over C&D on three of his last four appearances and has pretty obvious each-way claims.

runners.name: Denfield
runners.owner: Yue Yun Hing & Anita Yue Lam Chik Sun
runners.comment: Shade disappointing from favourable draw last time and absent for 12 weeks since
runners.spotlight: Has held his own in this higher grade since Class 4 C&D win in October but was a shade disappointing when favourably drawn on latest outing and has been off for 12 weeks since.

runners.name: Regal Gem

prev_owners.owner: D Bishop P Robinson S Bland T Coyle

runners.comment: Made quite encouraging Hong Kong debut when seventh over C&D last month; a possible
runners.spotlight: Dual 6f 2yo winner in Britain last year; made quite encouraging Hong Kong debut when seventh over C&D last month and has possibilities if that outing has brought him on.
